090a51b3db6349682e9021fd2bf28a439df3117c.body: USN-3524-1 mitigated CVE-2017-5754 (Meltdown) for the amd64 architecture in Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. This update provides the corresponding mitigations for the ppc64el architecture. Original advisory details:

a4010426405982156efe4d17f68c1004287e0cd0.title: USN-3523-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
a4010426405982156efe4d17f68c1004287e0cd0.body: Jann Horn discovered that microprocessors utilizing speculative execution and indirect branch prediction may allow unauthorized memory reads via sidechannel attacks. This flaw is known as Meltdown. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information, including kernel memory. (CVE-2017-5754)

d6a9a8d1d51faef7ce8b9584bf4cd87da2a930b7.title: USN-3522-4: Linux kernel (Xenial HWE) regression
d6a9a8d1d51faef7ce8b9584bf4cd87da2a930b7.body: USN-3522-2 fixed a vulnerability in the Linux Hardware Enablement kernel for Ubuntu 14.04 LTS to address Meltdown (CVE-2017-5754). Unfortunately, that update introduced a regression where a few systems failed to boot successfully. This update fixes the problem.

13a757a9659587c4e34c779e9bac065b95d606cd.title: USN-3522-3: Linux kernel regression
13a757a9659587c4e34c779e9bac065b95d606cd.body: USN-3522-1 fixed a vulnerability in the Linux kernel to address Meltdown (CVE-2017-5754). Unfortunately, that update introduced a regression where a few systems failed to boot successfully. This update fixes the problem.

4c7b5eee4c17c76c90740b41aef24b19cc91abcb.title: USN-3541-2: Linux kernel (HWE) vulnerabilities
4c7b5eee4c17c76c90740b41aef24b19cc91abcb.body: USN-3523-2 mitigated CVE-2017-5754 (Meltdown) for the amd64 architecture in the Linux Hardware Enablement (HWE) kernel from Ubuntu 17.10 for Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. This update provides the corresponding mitigations for the ppc64el architecture. Original advisory details:

0eca42f5662018e58f72d43bd017623b3d0c07db.title: USN-3540-2: Linux kernel (Xenial HWE) vulnerabilities
0eca42f5662018e58f72d43bd017623b3d0c07db.body: USN-3522-2 mitigated CVE-2017-5754 (Meltdown) for the amd64 architecture in the Linux Hardware Enablement (HWE) kernel from Ubuntu 16.04 LTS for Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. This update provides the corresponding mitigations for the ppc64el architecture. Original advisory details:

d7344274da99596aba016b08a4bc3acd1fd85989.title: USN-3525-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
d7344274da99596aba016b08a4bc3acd1fd85989.body: Details Jann Horn discovered that microprocessors utilizing speculative execution and indirect branch prediction may allow unauthorized memory reads via sidechannel attacks. This flaw is known as Meltdown. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information, including kernel memory.

2a637f2757a9d95537015fd038d790c3cc9d34e2.title: USN-3524-2: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerability
2a637f2757a9d95537015fd038d790c3cc9d34e2.body: Details USN-3524-1 fixed vulnerabilities in the Linux kernel for Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. This update provides the corresponding updates for the Linux Hardware Enablement (HWE) kernel from Ubuntu 14.04 LTS for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM. Jann Horn discovered that microprocessors utilizing speculative execution and indirect branch prediction may allow unauthorized memory reads via sidechannel attacks. This flaw is known as Meltdown. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information, including kernel memory.

eed388c2ea4f82e40a820f3971c387eb79b763e6.title: USN-3754-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
eed388c2ea4f82e40a820f3971c387eb79b763e6.body: Andrey Konovalov discovered an out-of-bounds access in the IPv6 Generic Routing Encapsulation (GRE) tunneling implementation in the Linux kernel. An attacker could use this to possibly expose sensitive information. (CVE-2017-5897)

e1b6a5f225f463108cddf5db388c43e1680433cb.title: USN-4016-1: Vim vulnerabilities
e1b6a5f225f463108cddf5db388c43e1680433cb.body: It was discovered that Vim incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. (CVE-2017-5953)

9ce5cba27f70a14e30d10aa7ff38a4f59c370d83.title: USN-4309-1: Vim vulnerabilities
9ce5cba27f70a14e30d10aa7ff38a4f59c370d83.body: It was discovered that Vim incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 ESM and Ubuntu 14.04 ESM. (CVE-2017-5953)

236a3ed47d32dfd4aec0131b62816223d6696480.title: USN-4470-1: sane-backends vulnerabilities
236a3ed47d32dfd4aec0131b62816223d6696480.body: Kritphong Mongkhonvanit discovered that sane-backends incorrectly handled certain packets. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive memory information. This issue only affected Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. (CVE-2017-6318)

6dfb07e53c7ae29021fd012125493d9f2ff31d46.title: USN-3754-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
6dfb07e53c7ae29021fd012125493d9f2ff31d46.body: Andrey Konovalov discovered that the LLC subsytem in the Linux kernel did not properly set up a destructor in certain situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2017-6345)

5a0b93025ab5bd3d62244867287301f712ee1a05.title: USN-4309-1: Vim vulnerabilities
5a0b93025ab5bd3d62244867287301f712ee1a05.body: It was discovered that Vim incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 ESM, Ubuntu 14.04 ESM and Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. (CVE-2017-6349, CVE-2017-6350)

de4d4469e6bc53e32c5e36d09f5ce4114c555a1d.title: USN-3707-2: NTP vulnerabilities
de4d4469e6bc53e32c5e36d09f5ce4114c555a1d.body: It was discovered that the NTP legacy DPTS refclock driver incorrectly handled the /dev/datum device. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2017-6462)

bbe43dab1091c2c72e96f73a4a087e1f0dc7726f.title: USN-3707-2: NTP vulnerabilities
bbe43dab1091c2c72e96f73a4a087e1f0dc7726f.body: It was discovered that NTP incorrectly handled certain invalid settings in a :config directive. A remote authenticated user could possibly use this issue to cause NTP to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2017-6463)

c4099fd7ed5f592bdf804293cc9c346f23894191.title: USN-4513-1: apng2gif vulnerability
c4099fd7ed5f592bdf804293cc9c346f23894191.body: Dileep Kumar Jallepalli discovered that apng2gif incorrectly handled loading APNG files. An attacker could exploit this with a crafted APNG file to access sensitive information. (CVE-2017-6960)

7fd98bd3bf6daaa6784e5ecea30df4188f0f0548.title: USN-4072-1: Ansible vulnerabilities
7fd98bd3bf6daaa6784e5ecea30df4188f0f0548.body: It was discovered that Ansible failed to properly handle sensitive information. A local attacker could use those vulnerabilities to extract them. (CVE-2017-7481) (CVE-2018-10855) (CVE-2018-16837) (CVE-2018-16876) (CVE-2019-10156)

eab9238228bfa13a9616bf9acf18db3876786966.title: USN-3583-2: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
eab9238228bfa13a9616bf9acf18db3876786966.body: It was discovered that an integer overflow vulnerability existing in the IPv6 implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (infinite loop). (CVE-2017-7542)

8b92f942613017bfafd3fcecbecc3375032dde08.title: USN-3583-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
8b92f942613017bfafd3fcecbecc3375032dde08.body: It was discovered that an integer overflow vulnerability existing in the IPv6 implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (infinite loop). (CVE-2017-7542)

e381380b6a232ff1aa561c4e46b57a48537e158b.title: USN-4277-1: libexif vulnerabilities
e381380b6a232ff1aa561c4e46b57a48537e158b.body: Lili Xu and Bingchang Liu discovered that libexif incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to access sensitive information or cause a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 ESM, Ubuntu 14.04 ESM and Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. (CVE-2017-7544)

5b6a121c8c90e3edbedc8432ff62141e17b427c8.title: USN-3754-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
5b6a121c8c90e3edbedc8432ff62141e17b427c8.body: Tuomas Haanpää and Ari Kauppi discovered that the NFSv2 and NFSv3 server implementations in the Linux kernel did not properly handle certain long RPC replies. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2017-7645)

b929012235bf6db4364101ffead6d87a13e17712.title: USN-3529-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
b929012235bf6db4364101ffead6d87a13e17712.body: It was discovered that a From address encoded with a null character is cut off in the message header display. An attacker could potentially exploit this to spoof the sender address. (CVE-2017-7829)

154660bf07653434328d56612677a9f103a6e825.title: USN-3583-2: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
154660bf07653434328d56612677a9f103a6e825.body: Mohamed Ghannam discovered a use-after-free vulnerability in the DCCP protocol implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2017-8824)

820207a16991bc12256ef1987871ca25697cdd42.title: USN-3583-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
820207a16991bc12256ef1987871ca25697cdd42.body: Mohamed Ghannam discovered a use-after-free vulnerability in the DCCP protocol implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2017-8824)

9e104b0f80b37870f7eee0185ddc739f4f9b99ce.title: USN-3582-2: Linux kernel (Xenial HWE) vulnerabilities
9e104b0f80b37870f7eee0185ddc739f4f9b99ce.body: Mohamed Ghannam discovered a use-after-free vulnerability in the DCCP protocol implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2017-8824)

d3c614f5dd5bc60251757d44cd1d9bbf0c8325ba.title: USN-3582-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
d3c614f5dd5bc60251757d44cd1d9bbf0c8325ba.body: Mohamed Ghannam discovered a use-after-free vulnerability in the DCCP protocol implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2017-8824)

e6c78ebeba3f87ec47bb4513e2d1c8d82d02db92.title: USN-3581-3: Linux kernel (Raspberry Pi 2) vulnerabilities
e6c78ebeba3f87ec47bb4513e2d1c8d82d02db92.body: Mohamed Ghannam discovered a use-after-free vulnerability in the DCCP protocol implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2017-8824)

277e4b9165a8803371af607401a579c70a10fc0f.title: USN-3581-2: Linux kernel (HWE) vulnerabilities
277e4b9165a8803371af607401a579c70a10fc0f.body: Mohamed Ghannam discovered a use-after-free vulnerability in the DCCP protocol implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2017-8824)

547bbf74888e4bca4d70b23c3762b7430599dd46.title: USN-3581-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
547bbf74888e4bca4d70b23c3762b7430599dd46.body: Mohamed Ghannam discovered a use-after-free vulnerability in the DCCP protocol implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2017-8824)

892d3008bcadadd6189ea1570f80e32fff35d461.title: USN-3754-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
892d3008bcadadd6189ea1570f80e32fff35d461.body: Pengfei Wang discovered that a race condition existed in the NXP SAA7164 TV Decoder driver for the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2017-8831)

05ac2923a9e218375d41f494352780c0b41fd36d.title: USN-3667-1: libytnef vulnerabilities
05ac2923a9e218375d41f494352780c0b41fd36d.body: It was discovered that libytnef incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this to access sensitive information. (CVE-2017-9058)

1d60acdec5926962695917c34d1960bd7b822da9.title: USN-4545-1: libquicktime vulnerabilities
1d60acdec5926962695917c34d1960bd7b822da9.body: It was discovered that libquicktime incorrectly handled certain malformed MP4 files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted MP4 file, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause libquicktime to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2017-9123, CVE-2017-9124, CVE-2017-9126, CVE-2017-9127, CVE-2017-9128)

89049c301b4a0e5903f4bcf36796091b6664f251.title: USN-4545-1: libquicktime vulnerabilities
89049c301b4a0e5903f4bcf36796091b6664f251.body: It was discovered that libquicktime incorrectly handled certain malformed MP4 files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted MP4 file, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2017-9125)

81efcf820dbca1953306777a39257ce66ccc196e.title: USN-3754-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
81efcf820dbca1953306777a39257ce66ccc196e.body: Pengfei Wang discovered that the Turtle Beach MultiSound audio device driver in the Linux kernel contained race conditions when fetching from the ring-buffer. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (infinite loop). (CVE-2017-9984, CVE-2017-9985)

6ffcf1d2f183a567cb43f5d247d51a6026cfd6e2.title: USN-3311-1: libnl vulnerability
6ffcf1d2f183a567cb43f5d247d51a6026cfd6e2.body: Details It was discovered that libnl incorrectly handled memory when performing certain operations. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to cause libnl to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or execute arbitrary code.

05ff480f4fa3657e5fb43c3d0ad1ebed20bb6f93.title: USN-3681-1: ImageMagick vulnerabilities
05ff480f4fa3657e5fb43c3d0ad1ebed20bb6f93.body: Details It was discovered that ImageMagick incorrectly handled certain malformed image files. If a user or automated system using ImageMagick were tricked into opening a specially crafted image, an attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service or possibly execute code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.

a69a473c27c3ea8c95878b7ce50cfd2777118fc5.title: USN-3562-1: MiniUPnP vulnerabilities
a69a473c27c3ea8c95878b7ce50cfd2777118fc5.body: Details It was discovered that MiniUPnP incorrectly handled memory. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code with privileges of the user running an application that uses the MiniUPnP library.

29fb6885ed3ca2eb0d3e239cb4e886ec478e2445.title: USN-3694-1: NASM vulnerabilities
29fb6885ed3ca2eb0d3e239cb4e886ec478e2445.body: Details It was discovered that NASM incorrectly handled certain source files. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted source file, a remote attacker could use these issues to cause NASM to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

bb69fafb5e22f4cbb71c5ab4d93c223c3278dfa6.title: USN-3567-1: Puppet vulnerability
bb69fafb5e22f4cbb71c5ab4d93c223c3278dfa6.body: Details It was discovered that Puppet incorrectly handled permissions when unpacking certain tarballs. A local user could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

1501d4cfd47fd20adc22bc611543905814f144ec.title: USN-4222-1: GraphicsMagick vulnerabilities
1501d4cfd47fd20adc22bc611543905814f144ec.body: Details It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

c1278040e6451d40ff8c57127669c26e0d794901.title: USN-3659-1: Spice vulnerability
c1278040e6451d40ff8c57127669c26e0d794901.body: Details Frediano Ziglio discovered that Spice incorrectly handled certain client messages. An attacker could possibly use this to cause Spice to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

f07d7118e123247b6b0beed6c9aea5efa74be998.title: USN-3912-1: GDK-PixBuf vulnerability
f07d7118e123247b6b0beed6c9aea5efa74be998.body: Details It was discovered that the GDK-PixBuf library did not properly handle certain BMP images. If an user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted BMP file, a remote attacker could use this flaw to cause GDK-PixBuf to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

850ce082d084ededb5b0b489969f3755483a8a69.title: USN-3638-1: QPDF vulnerabilities
850ce082d084ededb5b0b489969f3755483a8a69.body: Details It was discovered that QPDF incorrectly handled certain malformed files. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause QPDF to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

18708d1d2f7f0d6b7a46c9288f4b30beb4075ace.title: USN-4199-1: libvpx vulnerabilities
18708d1d2f7f0d6b7a46c9288f4b30beb4075ace.body: Details It was discovered that libvpx did not properly handle certain malformed WebM media files. If an application using libvpx opened a specially crafted WebM file, a remote attacker could cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

e23f968bdff3e8d379c4109f92521f603f3b7814.title: USN-4199-2: libvpx vulnerabilities
e23f968bdff3e8d379c4109f92521f603f3b7814.body: Details USN-4199-1 fixed several vulnerabilities in libvpx. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 14.04 ESM. Original advisory details: It was discovered that libvpx did not properly handle certain malformed WebM media files. If an application using libvpx opened a specially crafted WebM file, a remote attacker could cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

46beacd909331be5a54952690c9a738ac25986fd.title: USN-4232-1: GraphicsMagick vulnerabilities
46beacd909331be5a54952690c9a738ac25986fd.body: Details It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

db2738531f17f42b558cc79ca6e29e23b2a873f3.title: USN-4013-1: libsndfile vulnerabilities
db2738531f17f42b558cc79ca6e29e23b2a873f3.body: Details It was discovered that libsndfile incorrectly handled certain malformed files. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause libsndfile to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

594d336be1693b39e890dee708b61be1f21025fb.title: USN-3673-1: Unbound vulnerability
594d336be1693b39e890dee708b61be1f21025fb.body: Details Ralph Dolmans and Karst Koymans discovered that Unbound did not properly handle certain NSEC records. An attacker could use this to to prove the non-existence (NXDOMAIN answer) of an existing wildcard record, or trick Unbound into accepting a NODATA proof.

7363f39e97a3202f3a079ee19352be19c6ba9132.title: USN-3610-1: ICU vulnerability
7363f39e97a3202f3a079ee19352be19c6ba9132.body: Details It was discovered that ICU incorrectly handled certain calendars. If an application using ICU processed crafted data, a remote attacker could possibly cause it to crash, leading to a denial of service.

febb6bddc2f0a8550c5ef1195f0829e9e37a2749.title: USN-4248-1: GraphicsMagick vulnerabilities
febb6bddc2f0a8550c5ef1195f0829e9e37a2749.body: Details It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

a442ce0bdd86cc132261e001ebda23632459d9cb.title: USN-3622-1: Wayland vulnerability
a442ce0bdd86cc132261e001ebda23632459d9cb.body: Details It was discovered that the Wayland Xcursor support incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could use these issues to cause Wayland to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

5b4e818e1aff5d0fc3a3235cc41fec64f9d2c639.title: USN-4252-2: tcpdump vulnerabilities
5b4e818e1aff5d0fc3a3235cc41fec64f9d2c639.body: Details USN-4252-1 fixed several vulnerabilities in tcpdump. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM and Ubuntu 14.04 ESM. Original advisory details: Multiple security issues were discovered in tcpdump. A remote attacker could use these issues to cause tcpdump to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

fbc00c3519ad0015aa6f2c05f5643616e8f26876.title: USN-4252-1: tcpdump vulnerabilities
fbc00c3519ad0015aa6f2c05f5643616e8f26876.body: Details Multiple security issues were discovered in tcpdump. A remote attacker could use these issues to cause tcpdump to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

552629d3c072487010e4b3e93b8f1cbdffbc72b5.title: USN-3615-1: LibRaw vulnerabilities
552629d3c072487010e4b3e93b8f1cbdffbc72b5.body: Details It was discovered that LibRaw incorrectly handled photo files. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted photo file, a remote attacker could cause applications linked against LibRaw to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

b5e446ce2bde084a8a73240dadb951a66a841009.title: USN-3708-1: OpenSLP vulnerabilities
b5e446ce2bde084a8a73240dadb951a66a841009.body: Details It was discovered that OpenSLP incorrectly handled certain memory operations. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause OpenSLP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

2fffe54bdf117cb4f31c513fe4353b1094899273.title: USN-4266-1: GraphicsMagick vulnerabilities
2fffe54bdf117cb4f31c513fe4353b1094899273.body: Details It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

e5f6847dac1456f2c3fc8ade87a18f0f08242db0.title: USN-3668-1: Exempi vulnerabilities
e5f6847dac1456f2c3fc8ade87a18f0f08242db0.body: Details It was discovered that Exempi incorrectly handled certain media files. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted file, a remote attacker could cause Exempi to hang or crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

db9aa17c105a68c02a3da7f5626b48e6e1e6c4c5.title: USN-4574-1: libseccomp-golang vulnerability
db9aa17c105a68c02a3da7f5626b48e6e1e6c4c5.body: Details It was discovered that libseccomp-golang did not properly generate BPFs. If a process were running under a restrictive seccomp filter that specified multiple syscall arguments, the application could potentially bypass the intended restrictions put in place by seccomp.

1c24aeae9d8aedf3cc3b511e33d4f68fab46b270.title: USN-3794-1: MoinMoin vulnerability
1c24aeae9d8aedf3cc3b511e33d4f68fab46b270.body: Details It was discovered that MoinMoin incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to access sensitive information.

4c88271a82f8ee7992d79f7032fce864b2a1f391.title: USN-3733-1: GnuPG vulnerability
4c88271a82f8ee7992d79f7032fce864b2a1f391.body: Details Daniel J. Bernstein, Joachim Breitner, Daniel Genkin, Leon Groot Bruinderink, Nadia Heninger, Tanja Lange, Christine van Vredendaal, and Yuval Yarom discovered that GnuPG is vulnerable to a cache side-channel attack. A local attacker could use this attack to recover RSA private keys.

3874634b9d945a33f58a2f02e5699b86dcd537b2.title: USN-3733-2: GnuPG vulnerability
3874634b9d945a33f58a2f02e5699b86dcd537b2.body: Details USN-3733-1 fixed a vulnerability in GnuPG. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM. Original advisory details: Daniel J. Bernstein, Joachim Breitner, Daniel Genkin, Leon Groot Bruinderink, Nadia Heninger, Tanja Lange, Christine van Vredendaal, and Yuval Yarom discovered that GnuPG is vulnerable to a cache side-channel attack. A local attacker could use this attack to recover RSA private keys.

39737f93a03a796e0727df0ef292ffb64f9fc875.title: USN-4023-1: Mosquitto vulnerabilities
39737f93a03a796e0727df0ef292ffb64f9fc875.body: Details It was discovered that Mosquitto broker incorrectly handled certain specially crafted input and network packets. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service.

de57740fdc0744939cc6501bb7837220748d5a30.title: USN-3688-1: Spidermonkey vulnerabilities
de57740fdc0744939cc6501bb7837220748d5a30.body: Details Multiple memory safety issues were fixed in Spidermonkey. An attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service, or execute arbitrary code.

4fa75e0436e66837abe960b0ed31164b085610c7.title: USN-4042-1: poppler vulnerabilities
4fa75e0436e66837abe960b0ed31164b085610c7.body: Details It was discovered that poppler incorrectly handled certain files. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a crafted PDF file, an attacker could cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code

55a2e0b4e0f5405e69f771fe768b2d38b46d283b.title: USN-3592-2: ClamAV vulnerabilities
55a2e0b4e0f5405e69f771fe768b2d38b46d283b.body: It was discovered that ClamAV incorrectly handled parsing certain PDF files. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause ClamAV to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-0202)

6b91d04dc9189245960b2b453650a45829aa1103.title: USN-3592-1: ClamAV vulnerabilities
6b91d04dc9189245960b2b453650a45829aa1103.body: It was discovered that ClamAV incorrectly handled parsing certain PDF files. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause ClamAV to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-0202)

4db48a08639d2a7f36d24aa3029896ea20cfab8b.title: USN-3722-1: ClamAV vulnerabilities
4db48a08639d2a7f36d24aa3029896ea20cfab8b.body: It was discovered that ClamAV incorrectly handled parsing certain HWP files. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause ClamAV to hang, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2018-0360)

050a4eea08f863c6baf162a4f3efb85ca85cb93f.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled opcache access controls when configured to use PHP-FPM. A local user could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information from another user's PHP applications. (CVE-2018-10545)

746332444c3738270388db40c52a916f4ed5f97f.body: It was discovered that an integer overflow existed in git's pathname sanity checking code when used on NTFS filesystems. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service or expose sensitive information. (CVE-2018-11233)

8e9eb81ce15b6f536c198dd21697e6eb42b4e0c5.body: Etienne Stalmans discovered that git did not properly validate git submodules files. A remote attacker could possibly use this to craft a git repo that causes arbitrary code execution when "git clone --recurse-submodules" is used. (CVE-2018-11235)

b17c7ad53a27b5b8300938ed81c6359466465d96.body: It was discovered that the GNU C Library incorrectly handled certain pathname operations. 9c23a37b672017c9af37e2e66dff1ea97b9c80de.title: USN-3826-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
9c23a37b672017c9af37e2e66dff1ea97b9c80de.body: It was discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled the Slirp networking back-end. A privileged attacker inside the guest could use this issue to cause QEMU to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code on the host. In the default installation, when QEMU is used with libvirt, attackers would be isolated by the libvirt AppArmor profile. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Ubuntu 16.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.04 LTS. (CVE-2018-11806)

112713c9fbaa4efc085c5d174dc6b2d4564433ce.body: Ke Sun, Henrique Kawakami, Kekai Hu, Rodrigo Branco, Marina Minkin, Daniel Moghimi, Moritz Lipp, Michael Schwarz, Jo Van Bulck, Daniel Genkin, Daniel Gruss, Berk Sunar, Frank Piessens, and Yuval Yarom discovered that memory previously stored in microarchitectural store buffers of an Intel CPU core may be exposed to a malicious process that is executing on the same CPU core. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2018-12126)

6f8cd0d7fe0e1a077ee473ec0edff035ff6a7031.title: USN-4034-1: ImageMagick vulnerabilities
6f8cd0d7fe0e1a077ee473ec0edff035ff6a7031.body: Details It was discovered that ImageMagick incorrectly handled certain malformed image files. If a user or automated system using ImageMagick were tricked into opening a specially crafted image, an attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service or possibly execute code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. Due to a large number of issues discovered in GhostScript that prevent it from being used by ImageMagick safely, the update for Ubuntu 18.10 and Ubuntu 19.04 includes a default policy change that disables support for the Postscript and PDF formats in ImageMagick. This policy can be overridden if necessary by using an alternate ImageMagick policy configuration.

c0d35ee460b0b251283d5a9a2d4b06b85dfebe8f.body: Harry Sintonen discovered that curl incorrectly handled SASL authentication. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause curl to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-16839)

1f1fbf8056ca566d18a0708fcefaf6a4d1fadf16.body: Brian Carpenter discovered that curl incorrectly handled memory when closing certain handles. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause curl to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-16840)

eada2d6d1c92c03ae0535f808d314bdbdec17b70.body: Li Qiang discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled NVM Express Controller emulation. An attacker inside the guest could use this issue to cause QEMU to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code on the host. In the default installation, when QEMU is used with libvirt, attackers would be isolated by the libvirt AppArmor profile. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.10. (CVE-2018-16847)

11bf7908f6ff25d8f3aa70b5070bdf299504a104.body: Cfir Cohen discovered that a use-after-free vulnerability existed in the KVM implementation of the Linux kernel, when handling interrupts in environments where nested virtualization is in use (nested KVM virtualization is not enabled by default in Ubuntu kernels). a00ac0acfa1ba2df66feb62e48bd152c329d6695.body: Tim Blazytko, Cornelius Aschermann, Sergej Schumilo and Nils Bars discovered that Gnuplot did not properly validate string sizes in the df_generate_ascii_array_entry function. d75dda6c58899a8c411de9ca60a0f797f3457125.title: USN-3923-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
d75dda6c58899a8c411de9ca60a0f797f3457125.body: Li Quang and Saar Amar discovered multiple issues in the QEMU PVRDMA device. An attacker inside the guest could use these issues to cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.10. These issues were resolved by disabling PVRDMA support in Ubuntu 18.10. (CVE-2018-20123, CVE-2018-20124, CVE-2018-20125, CVE-2018-20126, CVE-2018-20191, CVE-2018-20216)

491ba8ecfc71bbaf6b489af2be71491013a0de6a.body: It was discovered that libjpeg-turbo incorrectly handled certain BMP images. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 19.04. (CVE-2018-20330)

ba38303d732a19d4e39f865857bbd423455aded6.body: It was discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled certain queries. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.10. (CVE-2018-20346, CVE-2018-20506)

a19192a8caf0e71cd80a856f8143c01556f1dc54.body: It was discovered that Python incorrectly handled certain pickle files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to consume memory, leading to a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 ESM. (CVE-2018-20406)

78f52e8501474f5bf48e7d01680c0e5f36f91e7e.body: It was discovered that the Appletalk IP encapsulation driver in the Linux kernel did not properly prevent kernel addresses from being copied to user space. e6e87b7afa083f9bf232040d64a8ba96fef40c87.body: It was discovered that poppler incorrectly handled certain PDF files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2018-20551, CVE-2019-7310)

e9a876aad6fa8fc446b2561a4b15a86d014c3276.body: It was discovered that HAProxy incorrectly handled certain requests. A attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.10. (CVE-2018-20103, CVE-2018-20615)

473785d86a5e2d7f333fd3d185e2f75dc459d574.body: Timothy Michaud discovered that the i915 graphics driver in the Linux kernel did not properly validate user memory locations for the i915_gem_execbuffer2_ioctl. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-20669)

404d9775172cfa9df2885f80760009f835a7345d.body: It was discovered that the BusyBox DHCP utilities incorrectly handled certain memory operations. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to access sensitive information. (CVE-2018-20679, CVE-2019-5747)

ad6cb3f9e86ff6dbb40cee83169abae35c28a520.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to access sensitive information. (CVE-2018-20783)

fd1daadc44c77ff419010ed246d40180343fa223.body: It was discovered that Vim incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 16.06 LTS. (CVE-2018-20786)

79f26b49dd31b45b79c668ad822024cc7487c45b.body: It was discovered that a race condition existed in the Serial Attached SCSI (SAS) implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-20836)

1d5faebad5aa9593e07353bd4e6c25c6ab0a3b5d.body: It was discovered that Python incorrectly validated the domain when handling cookies. An attacker could possibly trick Python into sending cookies to the wrong domain. (CVE-2018-20852)

3626e96136f3e62edfba4ff0cb166238e20132f0.body: It was discovered that Python incorrectly validated the domain when handling cookies. An attacker could possibly trick Python into sending cookies to the wrong domain. (CVE-2018-20852)

68e3f395903b3706c24e58d4c40fff06922b8f16.body: It was discovered that a use-after-free error existed in the block layer subsystem of the Linux kernel when certain failure conditions occurred. 90549b68b0267a5a625190bd0ba0832ef128e974.body: It was discovered that a use-after-free error existed in the block layer subsystem of the Linux kernel when certain failure conditions occurred. 419d7465b87b1aa9aac9c8772a233aa68bc5aaa2.body: It was discovered that the XFS file system in the Linux kernel did not properly handle mount failures in some situations. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-20976)

fe4de0e5211030b4506cc091d4aeb11d1dba81d8.body: It was discovered that the XFS file system in the Linux kernel did not properly handle mount failures in some situations. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-20976)

4e78783d258a8081e8efe57d65acd0074bc8991f.body: It was discovered that the RSI 91x Wi-Fi driver in the Linux kernel did not did not handle detach operations correctly, leading to a use-after-free vulnerability. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-21008)

9f09965bd0f380f2860df64f04b930aae520b268.body: It was discovered that the RSI 91x Wi-Fi driver in the Linux kernel did not did not handle detach operations correctly, leading to a use-after-free vulnerability. 5b5d3d0b68dd4dc8641a278e2dd1f454a03261e9.title: USN-3698-2: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
5b5d3d0b68dd4dc8641a278e2dd1f454a03261e9.body: Julian Stecklina and Thomas Prescher discovered that FPU register states (such as MMX, SSE, and AVX registers) which are lazily restored are potentially vulnerable to a side channel attack. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2018-3665)

67ab9078d4d51800e325bf513f13c69a065a8d52.body: Julian Stecklina and Thomas Prescher discovered that FPU register states (such as MMX, SSE, and AVX registers) which are lazily restored are potentially vulnerable to a side channel attack. b815dc4b90f4d20ca9adff391b2020ef77dacecf.body: Julian Stecklina and Thomas Prescher discovered that FPU register states (such as MMX, SSE, and AVX registers) which are lazily restored are potentially vulnerable to a side channel attack. c31a561fb210a4e049adf55f51728e3ce6b56285.body: Julian Stecklina and Thomas Prescher discovered that FPU register states (such as MMX, SSE, and AVX registers) which are lazily restored are potentially vulnerable to a side channel attack. 82e182bda3c3d808142b561024bf095b37a1e07e.title: USN-3544-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
82e182bda3c3d808142b561024bf095b37a1e07e.body: Multiple security issues were discovered in Firefox. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, spoof the origin in audio capture prompts, trick the user in to providing HTTP credentials for another origin, spoof the addressbar contents, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-5089, CVE-2018-5090, CVE-2018-5091, CVE-2018-5092, CVE-2018-5093, CVE-2018-5094, CVE-2018-5095, CVE-2018-5097, CVE-2018-5098, CVE-2018-5099, CVE-2018-5100, CVE-2018-5101, CVE-2018-5102, CVE-2018-5103, CVE-2018-5104, CVE-2018-5109, CVE-2018-5114, CVE-2018-5115, CVE-2018-5117, CVE-2018-5122)

16afff7d4e261b1ce9d125f1a0ad2ead7ad189f3.title: USN-3544-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
16afff7d4e261b1ce9d125f1a0ad2ead7ad189f3.body: A security issue was discovered with the developer tools. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website with the developer tools open, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information from other origins. (CVE-2018-5106)

9f4f2c00c8c274dcb43342c4ab68b8ad9b4d9782.title: USN-3544-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
9f4f2c00c8c274dcb43342c4ab68b8ad9b4d9782.body: It was discovered that manually entered blob URLs could be accessed by subsequent private browsing tabs. If a user were tricked in to entering a blob URL, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information from a private browsing context. (CVE-2018-5108)

628c4a527671c0ef1e63bcea5a33ca39621263d2.title: USN-3544-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
628c4a527671c0ef1e63bcea5a33ca39621263d2.body: It was discovered that dragging certain specially formatted URLs to the addressbar could cause the wrong URL to be displayed. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website and dragging a URL to the addressbar, an attacker could potentially exploit this to spoof the addressbar contents. (CVE-2018-5111)

cf878e39d158104d666556495194b458cb02cd8b.title: USN-3544-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
cf878e39d158104d666556495194b458cb02cd8b.body: It was discovered that ActivityStream images can attempt to load local content through file: URLs. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this in combination with another vulnerability that allowed sandbox protections to be bypassed, in order to obtain sensitive information from local files. (CVE-2018-5118)

a25954c83075e93ad00d201f88adf4bce1acfbe9.title: USN-3544-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
a25954c83075e93ad00d201f88adf4bce1acfbe9.body: It was discovered that the reader view will load cross-origin content in violation of CORS headers. An attacker could exploit this to bypass CORS restrictions. (CVE-2018-5119)

be6e64c31dc9533b26cd84a54177fdab44d6f4ae.title: USN-3596-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
be6e64c31dc9533b26cd84a54177fdab44d6f4ae.body: Multiple security issues were discovered in Firefox. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash or opening new tabs, escape the sandbox, bypass same-origin restrictions, obtain sensitive information, confuse the user with misleading permission requests, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-5125, CVE-2018-5126, CVE-2018-5127, CVE-2018-5128, CVE-2018-5129, CVE-2018-5130, CVE-2018-5136, CVE-2018-5137, CVE-2018-5140, CVE-2018-5141, CVE-2018-5142)

eab79823fdba4b9442581e61181695d108e6391a.title: USN-3545-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
eab79823fdba4b9442581e61181695d108e6391a.body: Multiple security issues were discovered in Thunderbird. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website in a browsing context, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-5125, CVE-2018-5127, CVE-2018-5129, CVE-2018-5144, CVE-2018-5145, CVE-2018-5146)

6e966d844d31a13b1a040ad903c5f248f3846835.title: USN-3596-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
6e966d844d31a13b1a040ad903c5f248f3846835.body: It was discovered that the fetch() API could incorrectly return cached copies of no-store/no-cache resources in some circumstances. A local attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information in environments where multiple users share a common profile. (CVE-2018-5131)

49b6f657c8e343aed4206159129735e86a527e44.title: USN-3596-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
49b6f657c8e343aed4206159129735e86a527e44.body: Multiple security issues were discovered with WebExtensions. If a user were tricked in to installing a specially crafted extension, an attacker could potentially exploit these to obtain sensitive information or bypass security restrictions. (CVE-2018-5132, CVE-2018-5134, CVE-2018-5135)

6c0c5fc61abd928d813920563bb5c154d0483374.title: USN-3596-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
6c0c5fc61abd928d813920563bb5c154d0483374.body: It was discovered that the value of app.support.baseURL is not sanitized properly. If a malicious local application were to set this to a specially crafted value, an attacker could potentially exploit this to execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-5133)

82d64f7ee14608a95e7dc1ec8878757c1ff15932.title: USN-3596-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
82d64f7ee14608a95e7dc1ec8878757c1ff15932.body: It was discovered that javascript: URLs with embedded tab characters could be pasted in to the addressbar. If a user were tricked in to copying a specially crafted URL in to the addressbar, an attacker could exploit this to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. (CVE-2018-5143)

499976c9f5aefa9de5db24edda707e71b0b089d5.title: USN-3599-1: Firefox vulnerability
499976c9f5aefa9de5db24edda707e71b0b089d5.body: An out-of-bounds write was discovered when processing Vorbis audio data. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-5146)

7f6a201c05287b4a1d5d4effd6e3e10b4e1fd013.title: USN-3604-1: libvorbis vulnerability
7f6a201c05287b4a1d5d4effd6e3e10b4e1fd013.body: Details Richard Zhu discovered that libvorbis incorrectly handled certain sound files. An attacker could use this to cause libvorbis to crash, resulting in a denial or service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

9d75201209bf026efe2808c3126ede6fa521afd7.title: USN-3660-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
9d75201209bf026efe2808c3126ede6fa521afd7.body: Multiple security issues were discovered in Thunderbird. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website in a browsing context, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, install lightweight themes without user interaction, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-5150, CVE-2018-5154, CVE-2018-5155, CVE-2018-5159, CVE-2018-5168, CVE-2018-5178)

702420e44ed59130c19599eba04dfbc1cf34c782.title: USN-3645-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
702420e44ed59130c19599eba04dfbc1cf34c782.body: Multiple security issues were discovered in Firefox. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, bypass same-origin restrictions, conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks, install lightweight themes without user interaction, spoof the filename in the downloads panel, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-5150, CVE-2018-5151, CVE-2018-5153, CVE-2018-5154, CVE-2018-5155, CVE-2018-5157, CVE-2018-5158, CVE-2018-5159, CVE-2018-5160, CVE-2018-5163, CVE-2018-5164, CVE-2018-5168, CVE-2018-5173, CVE-2018-5175, CVE-2018-5177, CVE-2018-5180)

a42b14020c84841c53489a397cca3d7f29f26f9b.body: An issue was discovered when processing message headers in Thunderbird. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted message, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application hang. (CVE-2018-5161)

03ec7fd68ff866c26bca86cc39a6f114f9fb6fac.title: USN-3645-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
03ec7fd68ff866c26bca86cc39a6f114f9fb6fac.body: Multiple security issues were discovered with WebExtensions. If a user were tricked in to installing a specially crafted extension, an attacker could potentially exploit these to obtain sensitive information, or bypass security restrictions. (CVE-2018-5152, CVE-2018-5166)

ff31c44f0167aec1a0c8a39b0753209c1656c703.title: USN-3645-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
ff31c44f0167aec1a0c8a39b0753209c1656c703.body: It was discovered that the web console and JavaScript debugger incorrectly linkified chrome: and javascript URLs. If a user were tricked in to clicking a specially crafted link, an attacker could potentially exploit this to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. (CVE-2018-5167)

70463b4078a647ee5fa8f04b410b01801a6f2fcb.title: USN-3645-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
70463b4078a647ee5fa8f04b410b01801a6f2fcb.body: It was discovered that dragging and dropping link text on to the home button could set the home page to include chrome pages. If a user were tricked in to dragging and dropping a specially crafted link on to the home button, an attacker could potentially exploit this bypass security restrictions. (CVE-2018-5169)

cbb4e19ee92416a25d34caf16c0f94c0b9ea6e59.title: USN-3660-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
cbb4e19ee92416a25d34caf16c0f94c0b9ea6e59.body: It was discovered that the filename of an attachment could be spoofed. An attacker could potentially exploit this by tricking the user in to opening an attachment of a different type to the one expected. (CVE-2018-5170)

a33d02f189f8c5b61e192e04c1410f5908cebf5a.title: USN-3645-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
a33d02f189f8c5b61e192e04c1410f5908cebf5a.body: It was discovered that the Live Bookmarks page and PDF viewer would run script pasted from the clipboard. If a user were tricked in to copying and pasting specially crafted text, an attacker could potentially exploit this to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. (CVE-2018-5172)

62036c9942959cffa2cd7d922cbd5ce666c94708.title: USN-3645-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
62036c9942959cffa2cd7d922cbd5ce666c94708.body: It was discovered that the JSON viewer incorrectly linkified javascript: URLs. If a user were tricked in to clicking on a specially crafted link, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2018-5176)

2408532439cbfd05b56bb34bfb3c60d6c153c7af.title: USN-3645-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
2408532439cbfd05b56bb34bfb3c60d6c153c7af.body: It was discovered that dragging a file: URL on to a tab that is running in a different process would cause the file to open in that process. If a user were tricked in to dragging a file: URL, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass intended security policies. (CVE-2018-5181)

f98a8d6203604e501bcda7a447bfdff2a9dcfac2.title: USN-3645-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
f98a8d6203604e501bcda7a447bfdff2a9dcfac2.body: It was discovered that dragging text that is a file: URL on to the addressbar would open the specified file. If a user were tricked in to dragging specially crafted text on to the addressbar, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass intended security policies. (CVE-2018-5182)

cc95435c5133d2d25c4669f086c7020072bc81eb.title: USN-3660-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
cc95435c5133d2d25c4669f086c7020072bc81eb.body: Multiple security issues were discovered in Skia. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted message, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-5183)

b1f5d47b69172d1ec6724231f80bf75ab733988e.title: USN-3749-1: Spidermonkey vulnerabilities
b1f5d47b69172d1ec6724231f80bf75ab733988e.body: Details Multiple memory safety issues were fixed in Spidermonkey. An attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service, or execute arbitrary code.

d60a12db62293007e66687a7c5ab16d07e886ca3.title: USN-3714-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
d60a12db62293007e66687a7c5ab16d07e886ca3.body: Details Multiple security issues were discovered in Thunderbird. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website in a browsing context, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service, bypass CORS restrictions, obtain sensitive information, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-12359, CVE-2018-12360, CVE-2018-12362, CVE-2018-12363, CVE-2018-12364, CVE-2018-12365, CVE-2018-12366) It was discovered that S/MIME and PGP decryption oracles can be built with HTML emails. An attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2018-12372) It was discovered that S/MIME plaintext can be leaked through HTML reply/forward. An attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2018-12373) It was discovered that forms can be used to exfiltrate encrypted mail parts by pressing enter in a form field. An attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2018-12374)

e95f7203c1335df906fc73106bfad6f4d56f6126.title: USN-3617-2: Linux (HWE) vulnerabilities
e95f7203c1335df906fc73106bfad6f4d56f6126.body: It was discovered that the Reliable Datagram Socket (RDS) implementation in the Linux kernel contained an out-of-bounds write during RDMA page allocation. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-5332)

da8e23e52978e980b2273d56e2c294e4c7fbc59d.title: USN-3573-1: Quagga vulnerabilities
da8e23e52978e980b2273d56e2c294e4c7fbc59d.body: It was discovered that the Quagga BGP daemon did not properly bounds check the data sent with a NOTIFY to a peer. c5a0d1f79428b8046a62a3c2d89a712a72688ffa.title: USN-3573-1: Quagga vulnerabilities
c5a0d1f79428b8046a62a3c2d89a712a72688ffa.body: It was discovered that a table overrun vulnerability existed in the Quagga BGP daemon. An attacker in control of a configured peer could use this to possibly expose sensitive information or possibly cause a denial of service. (CVE-2018-5380)

f9c268af5af7adcbe57925f82bcdcd6a91b3ae27.body: It was discovered that strongSwan incorrectly handled the stroke plugin. A local administrator could use this issue to cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-5388)

b7ec60a5696eb3f1b15227203cc07db82fecb881.body: Details Peter Wu discovered that curl incorrectly handled certain SMTP buffers. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause curl to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

600098dc93556750f56cbf8795704c27f0b58812.title: USN-3554-1: curl vulnerabilities
600098dc93556750f56cbf8795704c27f0b58812.body: Details It was discovered that curl incorrectly handled certain data. An attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service or even to get access to sensitive data. This issue only affected Ubuntu 16.04 LTS and Ubuntu 17.10. It was discovered that curl could accidentally leak authentication data. An attacker could possibly use this to get access to sensitive information. (CVE-2018-1000007)

e915506fd44587af093eee44faeb73984f54c1b2.title: USN-3605-1: Sharutils vulnerability
e915506fd44587af093eee44faeb73984f54c1b2.body: Details It was discovered that Sharutils incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this to execute arbitrary code.

a937250645323d3b5cffa948230c2af790c13906.body: Details It was discovered that the GPAC MP4Box utility incorrectly handled certain memory operations. If an user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted MP4 file, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause MP4Box to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

5cd93afff8a62ae7a0ebba9ab50b607a0e5a3e4a.title: USN-3601-1: Memcached vulnerability
5cd93afff8a62ae7a0ebba9ab50b607a0e5a3e4a.body: Details It was discovered that Memcached incorrectly handled reusing certain items. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Memcached to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

f83819a92371424032c609ff838b97541bdb7db4.body: Details Bas van Schaik and Kevin Backhouse discovered that librelp incorrectly handled checking certain x509 certificates. A remote attacker able to connect to rsyslog could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

63cc3011185ff7f5a1774b8e4ccd5a167844e871.title: USN-4378-1: Flask vulnerability
63cc3011185ff7f5a1774b8e4ccd5a167844e871.body: Details It was discovered that Flask incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

c2d2ffeef17e1bcf6d7761912cf5a2d13542de6a.body: Details It was discovered that FreeRDP incorrectly handled certain memory operations. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause FreeRDP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly exeucte arbitrary code.

aa43ba2bd4a48bbd8b9584ea5e9c85b542f58104.body: Details Ben Fuhrmannek discovered that GnuPG incorrectly handled Web Key Directory lookups. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service, or perform Cross-Site Request Forgery attacks.

769c8ec59f2968fc48fd8ea60b3ca354c6a7e773.body: Details It was discovered that GNU binutils contained a large number of security issues. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially-crafted file, a remote attacker could cause GNU binutils to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

a74f5956e149585d04f1b3b68433dff063a81c0a.body: Details It was discovered that LFTP incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

4a23a174ff68242dadaaa0137499938a1a0d9599.body: Details Joonun Jang discovered that AdvanceCOMP incorrectly handled certain malformed zip files. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted zip file, a remote attacker could cause AdvanceCOMP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

1613a753a7b3fbf4a42a26a68dd0f47fc22d733b.body: Details Maxime Coquelin discovered that DPDK incorrectly handled guest physical ranges. A malicious guest could use this issue to possibly access sensitive information.

0129cf762fe9be31b1d153b7e8c1cdf27dc0b42c.body: Details USN-3642-1 fixed a vulnerability in DPDK. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 17.10. Original advisory details: Maxime Coquelin discovered that DPDK incorrectly handled guest physical ranges. A malicious guest could use this issue to possibly access sensitive information.

c538c20cd180be9cae900fc0d35f7af343c65b71.title: USN-3906-1: LibTIFF vulnerabilities
c538c20cd180be9cae900fc0d35f7af343c65b71.body: Details It was discovered that LibTIFF incorrectly handled certain malformed images. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted image, a remote attacker could crash the application, leading to a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges.

cdf00e7b36dd303738e1e70622948122c5ff23fe.title: USN-3906-2: LibTIFF vulnerabilities
cdf00e7b36dd303738e1e70622948122c5ff23fe.body: Details USN-3906-1 and USN-3864-1 fixed several vulnerabilities in LibTIFF. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM. Original advisory details: It was discovered that LibTIFF incorrectly handled certain malformed images. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted image, a remote attacker could crash the application, leading to a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges.

d10438c038213e363322fd76ef88531f99f35067.title: USN-4000-1: Corosync vulnerability
d10438c038213e363322fd76ef88531f99f35067.body: Details It was discovered that Corosync incorrectly handled certain requests. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code.

0c9269b4f6476993784caed7e04ae8a8ca5355d5.title: USN-3703-2: Archive Zip vulnerability
0c9269b4f6476993784caed7e04ae8a8ca5355d5.body: Details USN-3703-1 fixed a vulnerability in Archive Zip module. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM. Original advisory details: It was discovered that the Archive Zip module incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this to access sensitive information.

1e6ebd474733db957e47fd9c6e922f9dc7a39dc6.title: USN-3703-1: Archive Zip
1e6ebd474733db957e47fd9c6e922f9dc7a39dc6.body: Details It was discovered that the Archive Zip module incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this to access sensitive information.

fa73652c535b9d2beef2e06838bcc023475e2b8e.title: USN-3751-1: Spice vulnerability
fa73652c535b9d2beef2e06838bcc023475e2b8e.body: Details It was discovered that Spice incorrectly handled certain messages. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

8a7ec3c6d5ad8cd71af25dba6534eab6db589a70.title: USN-3720-1: python-cryptography vulnerability
8a7ec3c6d5ad8cd71af25dba6534eab6db589a70.body: Details It was discovered that python-cryptography incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this to get access to sensitive information.

b93e6b313f9c6d3662071345d546c68023383103.body: Details USN-3731-1 fixed a vulnerability in LFTP. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM. Original advisory details: It was discovered that LFTP incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

8f10a15ecb72de313163fabb7b37696c7362be44.title: USN-3795-1: libssh vulnerability
8f10a15ecb72de313163fabb7b37696c7362be44.body: Details Peter Winter-Smith discovered that libssh incorrectly handled authentication when being used as a server. A remote attacker could use this issue to bypass authentication without any credentials.

769e229569d4e40e22cab52d5d0b0fe0f122ab41.title: USN-3795-2: libssh vulnerability
769e229569d4e40e22cab52d5d0b0fe0f122ab41.body: Details USN-3795-1 fixed a vulnerability in libssh. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 18.10. Original advisory details: Peter Winter-Smith discovered that libssh incorrectly handled authentication when being used as a server. A remote attacker could use this issue to bypass authentication without any credentials.

4ab488f1cc470e7839f9c6a7dbeeedc1168c8698.title: USN-3634-1: PackageKit vulnerability
4ab488f1cc470e7839f9c6a7dbeeedc1168c8698.body: Details Matthias Gerstner discovered that PackageKit incorrectly handled authentication. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to install arbitrary packages and escalate privileges.

08c92e019a1ffb050885beffd12295349020d24e.title: USN-3663-1: HAProxy vulnerability
08c92e019a1ffb050885beffd12295349020d24e.body: Details It was discovered that HAProxy incorrectly handled certain resquests. An attacker could possibly use this to expose sensitive information.

3c3f59efff127c488dc0d4a434d8d61e694795ef.title: USN-3810-1: ppp vulnerability
3c3f59efff127c488dc0d4a434d8d61e694795ef.body: Details Ivan Gotovchits discovered that ppp incorrectly handled the EAP-TLS protocol. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause ppp to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly bypass authentication.

ebcd2e50bf4fd0e301634ed74efb225fc9cd75ac.title: USN-3768-1: Ghostscript vulnerabilities
ebcd2e50bf4fd0e301634ed74efb225fc9cd75ac.body: Details Tavis Ormandy discovered multiple security issues in Ghostscript. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted file, a remote attacker could possibly use these issues to access arbitrary files, execute arbitrary code, or cause a denial of service.

bd5e97fde7ff0c27c49336a7fa8099c7b4ed337e.title: USN-3687-1: WebKitGTK+ vulnerabilities
bd5e97fde7ff0c27c49336a7fa8099c7b4ed337e.body: Details A large number of security issues were discovered in the WebKitGTK+ Web and JavaScript engines. If a user were tricked into viewing a malicious website, a remote attacker could exploit a variety of issues related to web browser security, including cross-site scripting attacks, denial of service attacks, and arbitrary code execution.

4b53bfe92c279131b411c5d1196088ed74a09d57.title: USN-4229-1: NTP vulnerability
4b53bfe92c279131b411c5d1196088ed74a09d57.body: Details It was discovered that ntpq and ntpdc incorrectly handled some arguments. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause ntpq or ntpdc to crash, execute arbitrary code, or escalate to higher privileges.

806c75dfe40ad1d44881e9a323cd823903fb162a.title: USN-3711-1: ImageMagick vulnerabilities
806c75dfe40ad1d44881e9a323cd823903fb162a.body: Details It was discovered that ImageMagick incorrectly handled certain malformed image files. If a user or automated system using ImageMagick were tricked into opening a specially crafted image, an attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service or possibly execute code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.

2ef087babb53caa33c16eff3059a0b2824791d1b.title: USN-4326-1: libiberty vulnerabilities
2ef087babb53caa33c16eff3059a0b2824791d1b.body: Details It was discovered that libiberty incorrectly handled parsing certain binaries. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted binary, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause libiberty to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code

77ebc6d5743996774545f7b356f87df7cee33689.title: USN-3701-1: libsoup vulnerability
77ebc6d5743996774545f7b356f87df7cee33689.body: Details It was discovered that libsoup incorrectly handled certain cookie requests. An attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service.

1035c9a1e8900ead302ad998f18026c6cce5be22.title: USN-3743-1: WebKitGTK+ vulnerabilities
1035c9a1e8900ead302ad998f18026c6cce5be22.body: Details A large number of security issues were discovered in the WebKitGTK+ Web and JavaScript engines. If a user were tricked into viewing a malicious website, a remote attacker could exploit a variety of issues related to web browser security, including cross-site scripting attacks, denial of service attacks, and arbitrary code execution.

0dbae4ea20219d48f6a6791b2a0cdd21c88e2676.title: USN-3704-1: devscripts vulnerability
0dbae4ea20219d48f6a6791b2a0cdd21c88e2676.body: Details It was discovered that devscripts incorrectly handled certain YAML files. An attacker could possibly use this to execute arbitrary code.

96869cb8065ba2da08fcceba22ade5d9992b0bec.title: USN-3757-1: poppler vulnerability
96869cb8065ba2da08fcceba22ade5d9992b0bec.body: Details Hosein Askari discovered that poppler incorrectly handled certain PDF files. An attacker could possible use this issue to cause a denial of service.

28c0d436c556547e0edfd36583b16773798bb9c4.title: USN-3737-1: GDM vulnerability
28c0d436c556547e0edfd36583b16773798bb9c4.body: Details A use-after-free was discovered in GDM. A local user could exploit this to cause a denial of service, or potentially execute arbitrary code as the administrator.

e568973f7c5f2ad14a5aebc96e8c58d699c20276.title: USN-3765-1: curl vulnerability
e568973f7c5f2ad14a5aebc96e8c58d699c20276.body: Details It was discovered that curl incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this to execute arbitrary code.

c570dc5f878fe7be0d9db0baaf95686cc87da520.title: USN-3765-2: curl vulnerability
c570dc5f878fe7be0d9db0baaf95686cc87da520.body: Details USN-3765-1 fixed a vulnerability in curl. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM. Original advisory details: It was discovered that curl incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this to execute arbitrary code.

d40bf5acb41b6f440ce4aa8e7fe07ca5ab5c5c3e.title: USN-3780-1: HAProxy vulnerability
d40bf5acb41b6f440ce4aa8e7fe07ca5ab5c5c3e.body: Details It was discovered that HAProxy incorrectly handled certain requests. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

25f2329166d7c6afad256eca08a6250d623e405b.title: USN-4276-1: Yubico PIV Tool vulnerabilities
25f2329166d7c6afad256eca08a6250d623e405b.body: Details It was discovered that libykpiv, a supporting library of the Yubico PIV Tool and YubiKey PIV Manager, mishandled specially crafted input. An attacker with a custom-made, malicious USB device could potentially execute arbitrary code on a computer running the Yubico PIV Tool or Yubikey PIV Manager.

953401ec81ffa73cb0f690de943b7d47718f1576.title: USN-3955-1: tcpflow vulnerabilities
953401ec81ffa73cb0f690de943b7d47718f1576.body: Details It was discovered that tcpflow incorrectly handled certain malformed network packets. A remote attacker could send these packets to a target system, causing tcpflow to crash or possibly disclose sensitive information.

189e83cf46626de2c28029fb926d8b62c6c82706.title: USN-3750-1: Pango vulnerability
189e83cf46626de2c28029fb926d8b62c6c82706.body: Details Jeffrey M. discovered that Pango incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

19b6ee6ee4c853698d7659ad313c29b3990103b5.title: USN-3789-1: ClamAV vulnerability
19b6ee6ee4c853698d7659ad313c29b3990103b5.body: Details It was discovered that ClamAV incorrectly handled unpacking MEW executables. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause ClamAV to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

d10da50ed5863ca1b49d20b08834bc2b4ca07d38.title: USN-3807-1: NetworkManager vulnerability
d10da50ed5863ca1b49d20b08834bc2b4ca07d38.body: Details Felix Wilhelm discovered that the NetworkManager internal DHCPv6 client incorrectly handled certain DHCPv6 messages. In non-default configurations where the internal DHCP client is enabled, an attacker on the same network could use this issue to cause NetworkManager to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

0896585eccb616922d16e20a3385b9fd2234eedc.title: USN-3806-1: systemd vulnerability
0896585eccb616922d16e20a3385b9fd2234eedc.body: Details Felix Wilhelm discovered that the systemd-networkd DHCPv6 client incorrectly handled certain DHCPv6 messages. In configurations where systemd-networkd is being used, an attacker on the same network could use this issue to cause systemd-networkd to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

6fbca09362dc40fe82326205bdcf3c3c2dca790d.title: USN-4012-1: elfutils vulnerabilities
6fbca09362dc40fe82326205bdcf3c3c2dca790d.body: Details It was discovered that elfutils incorrectly handled certain malformed files. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted file, elfutils could be made to crash or consume resources, resulting in a denial of service.

400ecfba3f789efaf495ac362408e532e7ff0c80.title: USN-3760-1: transfig vulnerability
400ecfba3f789efaf495ac362408e532e7ff0c80.body: Details It was discovered that transfig incorrectly handled certain FIG files. An attacker could possibly use this to execute arbitrary code.

2eae4e5276edfeba48590826023acbdb609bb595.title: USN-4089-1: Rack vulnerability
2eae4e5276edfeba48590826023acbdb609bb595.body: Details It was discovered that Rack incorrectly handled carefully crafted requests. A remote attacker could use this issue to execute a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack.

ff50c387ff80f4c13995993492685f193ecdff1d.title: USN-3773-1: Ghostscript vulnerabilities
ff50c387ff80f4c13995993492685f193ecdff1d.body: Details It was discovered that Ghostscript contained multiple security issues. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted file, a remote attacker could possibly use these issues to access arbitrary files, execute arbitrary code, or cause a denial of service.

fe4f3762ee45a624246386035106a3b45af28508.title: USN-3818-1: PostgreSQL vulnerability
fe4f3762ee45a624246386035106a3b45af28508.body: Details It was discovered that PostgreSQL incorrectly handled certain trigger definitions when running pg_upgrade or pg_dump. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary SQL statements with superuser privileges.

52c37dcd2c019c60c8b52e36549f1d092905662f.title: USN-3864-1: LibTIFF vulnerabilities
52c37dcd2c019c60c8b52e36549f1d092905662f.body: Details It was discovered that LibTIFF incorrectly handled certain malformed images. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted image, a remote attacker could crash the application, leading to a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code with user privileges.

c7e24bc2c12dfe544f39db545f1a592fd0520ebf.title: USN-3774-1: strongSwan vulnerability
c7e24bc2c12dfe544f39db545f1a592fd0520ebf.body: Details It was discovered that strongSwan incorrectly handled signature validation in the gmp plugin. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause strongSwan to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

5603d4ff04b37d2a0574b663860341c5c3786bd7.title: USN-3792-1: Net-SNMP vulnerability
5603d4ff04b37d2a0574b663860341c5c3786bd7.body: Details It was discovered that Net-SNMP incorrectly handled certain certain crafted packets. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Net-SNMP to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

746b1b86d92bcb36a330235d6603bbabb1be71cd.title: USN-3792-2: Net-SNMP vulnerability
746b1b86d92bcb36a330235d6603bbabb1be71cd.body: Details USN-3792-1 fixed a vulnerability in Net-SNMP. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM. Original advisory details: It was discovered that Net-SNMP incorrectly handled certain certain crafted packets. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Net-SNMP to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

7c048cfec5e4d24a25aed97873c4ccfbd57248fe.title: USN-3792-3: Net-SNMP vulnerability
7c048cfec5e4d24a25aed97873c4ccfbd57248fe.body: Details USN-3792-1 fixed a vulnerability in Net-SNMP. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 18.10. Original advisory details: It was discovered that Net-SNMP incorrectly handled certain certain crafted packets. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Net-SNMP to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

6ae18c0d477ed5c6f08193072c84f119bf60e4c1.title: USN-3803-1: Ghostscript vulnerabilities
6ae18c0d477ed5c6f08193072c84f119bf60e4c1.body: Details Tavis Ormandy discovered multiple security issues in Ghostscript. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted file, a remote attacker could possibly use these issues to access arbitrary files, execute arbitrary code, or cause a denial of service.

22d843b2c724b96e95dc33516a389e0452757f3f.title: USN-3997-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
22d843b2c724b96e95dc33516a389e0452757f3f.body: Details Multiple security issues were discovered in Thunderbird. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website in a browsing context, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service, bypass same-origin protections, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-18511, CVE-2019-11691, CVE-2019-11692, CVE-2019-11693, CVE-2019-9797, CVE-2019-9800, CVE-2019-9817, CVE-2019-9819, CVE-2019-9820) Multiple security issues were discovered in Thunderbird. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted message, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-5798, CVE-2019-7317) A type confusion bug was discovered with object groups and UnboxedObjects. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website in a browsing context after enabling the UnboxedObjects feature, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass security checks. (CVE-2019-9816) It was discovered that history data could be exposed via drag and drop of hyperlinks to and from bookmarks. If a user were tricked in to dragging a specially crafted hyperlink to a bookmark toolbar or sidebar, and subsequently back in to the web content area, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2019-11698)

a5dd509eb28da548194fac0340a98a5a0802b07c.title: USN-3995-1: Keepalived vulnerability
a5dd509eb28da548194fac0340a98a5a0802b07c.body: Details It was discovered that Keepalived incorrectly handled certain HTTP status response codes. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Keepalived to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

8384d99d9ba369e1394bc7de2d2a874d0abe5268.title: USN-3995-2: Keepalived vulnerability
8384d99d9ba369e1394bc7de2d2a874d0abe5268.body: Details USN-3995-1 fixed a vulnerability in keepalived. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM and Ubuntu 14.04 ESM. Original advisory details: It was discovered that Keepalived incorrectly handled certain HTTP status response codes. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Keepalived to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

3726cd4316ebc510053502a85777198e5d5509b0.title: USN-3841-2: lxml vulnerability
3726cd4316ebc510053502a85777198e5d5509b0.body: Details USN-3841-1 fixed a vulnerability in lxml. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM. Original advisory details: It was discovered that lxml incorrectly handled certain HTML files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.

49a9a4631f8192e31a78312cf3a0e67997c99d8d.title: USN-3841-1: lxml vulnerability
49a9a4631f8192e31a78312cf3a0e67997c99d8d.body: Details It was discovered that lxml incorrectly handled certain HTML files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.

1d7a6417da98e83f967b7c968f7e3a20598aa33d.title: USN-3861-2: PolicyKit vulnerability
1d7a6417da98e83f967b7c968f7e3a20598aa33d.body: Details USN-3861-1 fixed a vulnerability in PolicyKit. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM. Original advisory details: It was discovered that PolicyKit incorrectly handled certain large user UIDs. A local attacker with a large UID could possibly use this issue to perform privileged actions.

ee7514427b8e470c3ccddf8676887f31f81fc095.title: USN-3861-1: PolicyKit vulnerability
ee7514427b8e470c3ccddf8676887f31f81fc095.body: Details It was discovered that PolicyKit incorrectly handled certain large user UIDs. A local attacker with a large UID could possibly use this issue to perform privileged actions.

945f870b80d6fe6cf0d6544690c150139d8b0480.body: Details It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

fe4e3f6e54ab74bcc29a6b1c971c97c6aa4c4cfe.title: USN-3989-1: LibRaw vulnerabilities
fe4e3f6e54ab74bcc29a6b1c971c97c6aa4c4cfe.body: Details It was discovered that LibRaw incorrectly handled photo files. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted photo file, a remote attacker could cause applications linked against LibRaw to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

0a229d8dfaea900d34a3fda8daadc199fbddba74.title: USN-3916-1: libsolv vulnerabilities
0a229d8dfaea900d34a3fda8daadc199fbddba74.body: Details It was discovered that libsolv incorrectly handled certain malformed input. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted file, applications that rely on libsolv could be made to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

929f0a0a0bb92172ee79c072a984a887a4add653.title: USN-3860-2: libcaca vulnerabilities
929f0a0a0bb92172ee79c072a984a887a4add653.body: Details USN-3860-1 fixed a vulnerability in libcaca. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM. Original advisory details: It was discovered that libcaca incorrectly handled certain images. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2018-20544) It was discovered that libcaca incorrectly handled certain images. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-20545, CVE-2018-20548, CVE-2018-20459) It was discovered that libcaca incorrectly handled certain images. An attacker could possibly use this issue to access sensitive information. (CVE-2018-20546, CVE-2018-20547)

a5a81c26f6282d48c831f6ff85126cfaaa48883f.title: USN-3860-1: libcaca vulnerabilities
a5a81c26f6282d48c831f6ff85126cfaaa48883f.body: Details It was discovered that libcaca incorrectly handled certain images. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2018-20544) It was discovered that libcaca incorrectly handled certain images. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2018-20545, CVE-2018-20548, CVE-2018-20459) It was discovered that libcaca incorrectly handled certain images. An attacker could possibly use this issue to access sensitive information. (CVE-2018-20546, CVE-2018-20547)

c47f502b3d0c6c9d7f0041e195665167581b6a47.body: Details It was discovered that SDL_image incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.
