e4d15bf5c233bad6eeefac313e9c12433aabd245.body: Details A large number of security issues were discovered in the WebKitGTK+ Web and JavaScript engines. If a user were tricked into viewing a malicious website, a remote attacker could exploit a variety of issues related to web browser security, including cross-site scripting attacks, denial of service attacks, and arbitrary code execution.

70f2be954787d66b934e21d2eb2110db54755215.title: USN-3640-1: WebKitGTK+ vulnerability
70f2be954787d66b934e21d2eb2110db54755215.body: Details Ivan Fratric discovered that WebKitGTK+ incorrectly handled certain web content. If a user were tricked into viewing a malicious website, a remote attacker could possibly exploit this to execute arbitrary code.

9c2cc3bfa8819b3e503390aebe0df6a04e77de0a.title: USN-3781-1: WebKitGTK+ vulnerabilities
9c2cc3bfa8819b3e503390aebe0df6a04e77de0a.body: Details A large number of security issues were discovered in the WebKitGTK+ Web and JavaScript engines. If a user were tricked into viewing a malicious website, a remote attacker could exploit a variety of issues related to web browser security, including cross-site scripting attacks, denial of service attacks, and arbitrary code execution.

724ac824a367c4f32042f19ee070f648e30708f9.title: USN-3609-1: Firefox vulnerability
724ac824a367c4f32042f19ee070f648e30708f9.body: Details A use-after-free was discovered in Firefox. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code.

425b25d10c64eb634205d52c63265e572762f1a8.title: USN-3546-1: gcab vulnerability
425b25d10c64eb634205d52c63265e572762f1a8.body: Details Richard Hughes discovered that gcab incorrectly handled certain malformed cabinet files. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted cabinet file, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause gcab to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

aad319e1b94e4fb4fce46415194b43b30a0d317d.title: USN-3683-1: Bind vulnerability
aad319e1b94e4fb4fce46415194b43b30a0d317d.body: Details Andrew Skalski discovered that Bind could incorrectly enable recursion when the "allow-recursion" setting wasn't specified. This issue could improperly permit recursion to all clients, contrary to expectations.

4f71ed43028cfd41260ab0ef70d009c6ce9fbfaf.title: USN-3838-1: LibRaw vulnerabilities
4f71ed43028cfd41260ab0ef70d009c6ce9fbfaf.body: Details It was discovered that LibRaw incorrectly handled photo files. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted photo file, a remote attacker could cause applications linked against LibRaw to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

6cdd6e3a03a4836ef9e67b43c8c78b4665cd2800.title: USN-3563-1: Mailman vulnerability
6cdd6e3a03a4836ef9e67b43c8c78b4665cd2800.body: Details It was discovered that Mailman incorrectly handled certain web scripts. An attacker could possibly use this to inject arbitrary code.

276ac31769c88397802f412f34fe19c115a6ad7d.title: USN-4165-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
276ac31769c88397802f412f34fe19c115a6ad7d.body: Details Multiple security issues were discovered in Firefox. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service, bypass security restrictions, bypass same-origin restrictions, conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks, bypass content security policy (CSP) protections, or execute arbitrary code.

072704ac4c4f5003f1754507f2727eb3833008d5.title: USN-3662-1: NVIDIA graphics drivers vulnerabilities
072704ac4c4f5003f1754507f2727eb3833008d5.body: Details It was discovered that the NVIDIA graphics drivers contained flaws in the kernel mode layer. A local attacker could use these issues to cause a denial of service or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

b16a5f4c27abf9dbf8dd653090ce66fcfa5b2293.title: USN-3904-1: NVIDIA graphics drivers vulnerability
b16a5f4c27abf9dbf8dd653090ce66fcfa5b2293.body: Details It was discovered that the NVIDIA graphics drivers incorrectly handled the GPU performance counters. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to access the application data processed on the GPU.

13dc4dde9eb9b6ffa5bab5897d60869b6ff9a684.title: USN-3699-1: zziplib vulnerabilities
13dc4dde9eb9b6ffa5bab5897d60869b6ff9a684.body: Details It was discovered that zziplib incorrectly handled certain malformed ZIP files. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted ZIP file, a remote attacker could cause zziplib to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

903ebc65b17d8491967e130547383a7a0b818e12.title: USN-3565-1: Exim vulnerability
903ebc65b17d8491967e130547383a7a0b818e12.body: Details Meh Chang discovered that Exim incorrectly handled memory in certain decoding operations. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Exim to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

536a0666e1b00ff0febee9132ad8c76514e7ef3d.title: USN-3572-1: FreeType vulnerability
536a0666e1b00ff0febee9132ad8c76514e7ef3d.body: Details It was discovered that FreeType incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service.

1301a6aef1a00ad1f955367867ea56de0426cbf8.title: USN-3603-2: Paramiko vulnerability
1301a6aef1a00ad1f955367867ea56de0426cbf8.body: Details USN-3603-1 fixed a vulnerability in Paramiko. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM. Original advisory details: Matthijs Kooijman discovered that Paramiko's SSH server implementation did not properly require authentication before processing requests. An unauthenticated remote attacker could possibly use this to execute arbitrary code.

48780b89775319102199a938e97e5eb4d072a346.title: USN-3603-1: Paramiko vulnerability
48780b89775319102199a938e97e5eb4d072a346.body: Details Matthijs Kooijman discovered that Paramiko's SSH server implementation did not properly require authentication before processing requests. An unauthenticated remote attacker could possibly use this to execute arbitrary code.

37786a2fff1d026e653311790486439bdc2d5667.title: USN-4240-1: Kamailio vulnerability
37786a2fff1d026e653311790486439bdc2d5667.body: Details It was discovered that Kamailio incorrectly handled a specially crafted file. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

aa70caef860f8bc6689e85f3f67543f483b8435a.title: USN-4186-2: Linux kernel (Xenial HWE) vulnerabilities
aa70caef860f8bc6689e85f3f67543f483b8435a.body: It was discovered that the Intel i915 graphics chipsets allowed userspace to modify page table entries via writes to MMIO from the Blitter Command Streamer and expose kernel memory information. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information or possibly elevate privileges. (CVE-2019-0155)

2318e3657238f60b644d7c22aa62c8825ee83ebd.title: USN-3937-1: Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
2318e3657238f60b644d7c22aa62c8825ee83ebd.body: Craig Young discovered that the Apache HTTP Server HTTP/2 module incorrectly handled certain requests. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause the server to process requests incorrectly. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.10. (CVE-2019-0196)

aa70f4466bec89711c1d96e3198e475dc1f8518f.title: USN-3937-1: Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
aa70f4466bec89711c1d96e3198e475dc1f8518f.body: Charles Fol discovered that the Apache HTTP Server incorrectly handled the scoreboard shared memory area. A remote attacker able to upload and run scripts could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code with root privileges. (CVE-2019-0211)

880b7bae55251a590d50a88ddd8d81be9e5c7663.title: USN-4128-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
880b7bae55251a590d50a88ddd8d81be9e5c7663.body: It was discovered that the Tomcat 8 SSI printenv command echoed user provided data without escaping it. An attacker could possibly use this issue to perform an XSS attack. (CVE-2019-0221)

0b3d80af8078133337d7400e46ce2152d4ada28b.title: USN-4128-2: Tomcat vulnerabilities
0b3d80af8078133337d7400e46ce2152d4ada28b.body: It was discovered that the Tomcat 9 SSI printenv command echoed user provided data without escaping it. An attacker could possibly use this issue to perform an XSS attack. (CVE-2019-0221)

c97e8462f1dfcf8e5035cf50f1cabbae77808883.title: USN-3884-1: libarchive vulnerabilities
c97e8462f1dfcf8e5035cf50f1cabbae77808883.body: It was discovered that libarchive incorrectly handled certain 7zip files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2019-1000019, CVE-2019-1000020)

eaf2202a857eed00803e406aca62e54d7f66835b.title: USN-4113-1: Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
eaf2202a857eed00803e406aca62e54d7f66835b.body: Craig Young discovered that a memory overwrite error existed in Apache when performing HTTP/2 very early pushes in some situations. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (daemon crash). This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 19.04. (CVE-2019-10081)

2885ec7d438bed8372dcb0b9e12fdf6d8a440ab1.title: USN-4113-1: Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
2885ec7d438bed8372dcb0b9e12fdf6d8a440ab1.body: Matei Badanoiu discovered that the mod_proxy component of Apache did not properly filter URLs when reporting errors in some configurations. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. (CVE-2019-10092)

654ae5fe9215ad54bcd531c9de377e4426cf8c0f.title: USN-4095-2: Linux kernel (Xenial HWE) vulnerabilities
654ae5fe9215ad54bcd531c9de377e4426cf8c0f.body: It was discovered that a heap buffer overflow existed in the Marvell Wireless LAN device driver for the Linux kernel. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-10126)

b831de4a4c23d45d7a6a25dc03168aa21f019fdf.title: USN-4095-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
b831de4a4c23d45d7a6a25dc03168aa21f019fdf.body: It was discovered that a heap buffer overflow existed in the Marvell Wireless LAN device driver for the Linux kernel. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-10126)

f9d99e4c4b2ae003b122fc1f406547d1fcf68e46.title: USN-4094-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
f9d99e4c4b2ae003b122fc1f406547d1fcf68e46.body: It was discovered that a heap buffer overflow existed in the Marvell Wireless LAN device driver for the Linux kernel. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-10126)

118b9d720c1bc4739253e40e0dbfb6614e77a105.title: USN-4093-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
118b9d720c1bc4739253e40e0dbfb6614e77a105.body: It was discovered that a heap buffer overflow existed in the Marvell Wireless LAN device driver for the Linux kernel. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-10126)

daf74584c44f1cf6b85956f80e0c94643ee706e9.title: USN-4117-1: Linux kernel (AWS) vulnerabilities
daf74584c44f1cf6b85956f80e0c94643ee706e9.body: It was discovered that a heap buffer overflow existed in the Marvell Wireless LAN device driver for the Linux kernel. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-10126)

d9da588010ca470c384924b8b0c0cf5de388ca98.title: USN-4118-1: Linux kernel (AWS) vulnerabilities
d9da588010ca470c384924b8b0c0cf5de388ca98.body: It was discovered that a heap buffer overflow existed in the Marvell Wireless LAN device driver for the Linux kernel. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-10126)

f1cd65ae6b073acb5f6af26644efcd4fec7594b6.title: USN-4021-1: libvirt vulnerabilities
f1cd65ae6b073acb5f6af26644efcd4fec7594b6.body: Daniel P. Berrangé discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled socket permissions. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to access libvirt. (CVE-2019-10132)

b5d288098ea700f76c8471ce60eba278ba956b24.title: USN-4226-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
b5d288098ea700f76c8471ce60eba278ba956b24.body: Michael Hanselmann discovered that the CIFS implementation in the Linux kernel did not sanitize paths returned by an SMB server. An attacker controlling an SMB server could use this to overwrite arbitrary files. (CVE-2019-10220)

7a5146fb243892127a546f4ccfaeb5b845e79b3f.title: USN-3566-2: PHP vulnerabilities
7a5146fb243892127a546f4ccfaeb5b845e79b3f.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to access sensitive information or possibly cause a crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2019-11036)

7d8ed68d58f25b237341ff0333702f38d789359f.title: USN-4009-1: PHP vulnerabilities
7d8ed68d58f25b237341ff0333702f38d789359f.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain exif tags in images. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2019-11036)

d6081f6ab4af0044384ae7209b8ecfa8a0829a2d.title: USN-4097-2: PHP vulnerabilities
d6081f6ab4af0044384ae7209b8ecfa8a0829a2d.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain images. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-11041, CVE-2019-11042)

f84e4d23c327746cc8ebe585ae31d61685d93334.title: USN-4097-1: PHP vulnerabilities
f84e4d23c327746cc8ebe585ae31d61685d93334.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain images. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-11041, CVE-2019-11042)

61282e67b6516c64aa5951c7cdf54863471de710.title: USN-4239-1: PHP vulnerabilities
61282e67b6516c64aa5951c7cdf54863471de710.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2019-11046)

55ce10e2b58f816adaa407bd43dfc1cb44c7d06a.title: USN-4239-1: PHP vulnerabilities
55ce10e2b58f816adaa407bd43dfc1cb44c7d06a.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain images. An attacker could possibly use this issue to access sensitive information. (CVE-2019-11047, CVE-2019-11050)

d0ca3583994c245f9e9469b661b19a94481baa21.title: USN-4536-1: SPIP vulnerabilities
d0ca3583994c245f9e9469b661b19a94481baa21.body: Guillaume Fahrner discovered that SPIP did not properly sanitize input. A remote authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code on the host server. (CVE-2019-11071)

bac809324467787f1bd33d9391de52fc2f5a32c6.title: USN-4068-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
bac809324467787f1bd33d9391de52fc2f5a32c6.body: Adam Zabrocki discovered that the Intel i915 kernel mode graphics driver in the Linux kernel did not properly restrict mmap() ranges in some situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-11085)

a42403e884ca5da21315bf558d325bc7fafdb02e.title: USN-4068-2: Linux kernel (HWE) vulnerabilities
a42403e884ca5da21315bf558d325bc7fafdb02e.body: Adam Zabrocki discovered that the Intel i915 kernel mode graphics driver in the Linux kernel did not properly restrict mmap() ranges in some situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-11085)

d5cd2d56625e0d21a00de73031b1b7f696bfade8.title: USN-4118-1: Linux kernel (AWS) vulnerabilities
d5cd2d56625e0d21a00de73031b1b7f696bfade8.body: Adam Zabrocki discovered that the Intel i915 kernel mode graphics driver in the Linux kernel did not properly restrict mmap() ranges in some situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-11085)

bce08d999243cd89b06bcd1954561cb894add7dc.title: USN-3954-1: FreeRADIUS vulnerabilities
bce08d999243cd89b06bcd1954561cb894add7dc.body: It was discovered that FreeRADIUS incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass authentication. (CVE-2019-11234, CVE-2019-11235)

6f7d55408d5b4326f2a7a0b09da79dd8aa9d7160.title: USN-4431-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
6f7d55408d5b4326f2a7a0b09da79dd8aa9d7160.body: It was discovered that FFmpeg incorrectly verified empty audio packets or HEVC data. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service via a crafted file. This issue only affected Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, as it was already fixed in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS. For more information see: https://usn.ubuntu.com/usn/usn-3967-1 (CVE-2018-15822, CVE-2019-11338)

341b6f4a4b8d89447d745291c04100a9c8a7aa39.title: USN-3967-1: FFmpeg vulnerabilities
341b6f4a4b8d89447d745291c04100a9c8a7aa39.body: Details It was discovered that FFmpeg contained multiple security issues when handling certain multimedia files. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted multimedia file, an attacker could cause a denial of service via application crash.

6f60bb5c320c5a77ef7b4879a1e8a29a068aacbd.title: USN-4566-1: Cyrus IMAP Server vulnerabilities
6f60bb5c320c5a77ef7b4879a1e8a29a068aacbd.body: It was dicovered that Cyrus IMAP Server could execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTTP PUT operation for an event with a long iCalendar property name. An attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a crash or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-11356)

42f7c51a200d29f7b577630451b0b6e0add7371b.title: USN-4540-1: atftpd vulnerabilities
42f7c51a200d29f7b577630451b0b6e0add7371b.body: Denis Andzakovic discovered that atftpd incorrectly handled certain malformed packets. A remote attacker could send a specially crafted packet to cause atftpd to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2019-11365)

11c3431eb4d29092235959ff4a87a6917896c2e5.title: USN-4540-1: atftpd vulnerabilities
11c3431eb4d29092235959ff4a87a6917896c2e5.body: Denis Andzakovic discovered that atftpd did not properly lock the thread list mutex. An attacker could send a large number of tftpd packets simultaneously when running atftpd in daemon mode to cause atftpd to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2019-11366)

607a78326096d17688fb808d8d31b9fe3a9bd862.title: USN-3971-1: Monit vulnerabilities
607a78326096d17688fb808d8d31b9fe3a9bd862.body: Zack Flack discovered that Monit incorrectly handled certain input. A remote authenticated user could exploit this to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. (CVE-2019-11454)

72b0d15e8b5e2eb1655263893619a3968239f7fa.title: USN-3971-1: Monit vulnerabilities
72b0d15e8b5e2eb1655263893619a3968239f7fa.body: Zack Flack discovered a buffer overread when Monit decoded certain crafted URLs. An attacker could exploit this to leak potentially sensitive information. (CVE-2019-11455)

af74560af90decfbd0f787e19366d61ae8715d35.title: USN-4069-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
af74560af90decfbd0f787e19366d61ae8715d35.body: It was discovered that an integer overflow existed in the Linux kernel when reference counting pages, leading to potential use-after-free issues. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-11487)

9dfc695afaaacad4ae0e98bd04bf3aee2f5fe25e.title: USN-4069-2: Linux kernel (HWE) vulnerabilities
9dfc695afaaacad4ae0e98bd04bf3aee2f5fe25e.body: It was discovered that an integer overflow existed in the Linux kernel when reference counting pages, leading to potential use-after-free issues. b8493735a78acd59d10c501e4e7d95815ebbb8a5.title: USN-4118-1: Linux kernel (AWS) vulnerabilities
b8493735a78acd59d10c501e4e7d95815ebbb8a5.body: It was discovered that an integer overflow existed in the Linux kernel when reference counting pages, leading to potential use-after-free issues. 99964a6bf4b6ae9c917039940a8f5e30b25b2497.title: USN-4145-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
99964a6bf4b6ae9c917039940a8f5e30b25b2497.body: It was discovered that an integer overflow existed in the Linux kernel when reference counting pages, leading to potential use-after-free issues. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-11487)

39f5a22a30f8dd52567c439a15d3fb6141aa4276.title: USN-3979-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
39f5a22a30f8dd52567c439a15d3fb6141aa4276.body: It was discovered that the IPv4 generic receive offload (GRO) for UDP implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly handle padded packets. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2019-11683)

d9137078b7a8bffa6579d8895b38fd95744c45ba.title: USN-4150-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
d9137078b7a8bffa6579d8895b38fd95744c45ba.body: Multiple security issues were discovered in Thunderbird. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website in a browsing context, an attacker could potentially exploit these to obtain sensitive information, conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attack, scause a denial of service, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-11740, CVE-2019-11742, CVE-2019-11743, CVE-2019-11744, CVE-2019-11746, CVE-2019-11752)

8f4666616d97463bba93262bc0d8dc17eab73631.body: It was discovered that NSS incorrectly handled certain memory operations. A remote attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-11745)

ea8420de33e5b151ea181a0c0da01264635aa1ca.body: It was discovered that NSS incorrectly handled certain memory operations. A remote attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-11745)

05346d75f535b754a81fd66a43380ca767004f6e.body: It was discovered that a null pointer dereference vulnerability existed in the LSI Logic MegaRAID driver in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2019-11810)

ab3158f310671b09207e9ba54b5cd31424e7f18f.body: It was discovered that a null pointer dereference vulnerability existed in the LSI Logic MegaRAID driver in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2019-11810)

31ff45fd96fe2779c3b0cf9576de8ca73c9ed8ee.body: It was discovered that a null pointer dereference vulnerability existed in the LSI Logic MegaRAID driver in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2019-11810)

ab0b494ffc1238b4239e7fb5fb7d9da6a13eb3ae.title: USN-4118-1: Linux kernel (AWS) vulnerabilities
ab0b494ffc1238b4239e7fb5fb7d9da6a13eb3ae.body: It was discovered that a null pointer dereference vulnerability existed in the LSI Logic MegaRAID driver in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2019-11810)

b534d5a784a83e1a4328d16a5286acd5c3a92e79.title: USN-4542-1: MiniUPnPd vulnerabilities
b534d5a784a83e1a4328d16a5286acd5c3a92e79.body: It was discovered that MiniUPnPd incorrectly handled unpopulated user XML input. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause MiniUPnPd to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2019-12108, CVE-2019-12109)

10c346605360c9f1aa7f198d699d6a237a2419a2.title: USN-4542-1: MiniUPnPd vulnerabilities
10c346605360c9f1aa7f198d699d6a237a2419a2.body: It was discovered that MiniUPnPd incorrectly handled an empty description when port mapping. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause MiniUPnPd to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2019-12110)

8ef5dd8d0083808a367f635613e7291fdccbea89.title: USN-4542-1: MiniUPnPd vulnerabilities
8ef5dd8d0083808a367f635613e7291fdccbea89.body: It was discovered that MiniUPnPd did not properly parse certain PCP requests. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause MiniUPnPd to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2019-12111)

696a02e4cc1327b2acefa9cc35400d1a1fbf6e16.title: USN-4191-2: QEMU vulnerabilities
696a02e4cc1327b2acefa9cc35400d1a1fbf6e16.body: Sergej Schumilo, Cornelius Aschermann and Simon Wörner discovered that the qxl paravirtual graphics driver implementation in QEMU contained a null pointer dereference. A local attacker in a guest could use this to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2019-12155)

0f58bda6fdc6204881a3f07261db7e220b01c59e.title: USN-4191-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
0f58bda6fdc6204881a3f07261db7e220b01c59e.body: Sergej Schumilo, Cornelius Aschermann and Simon Wörner discovered that the qxl paravirtual graphics driver implementation in QEMU contained a null pointer dereference. A local attacker in a guest could use this to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2019-12155)

892af39885712f42f283a57e40b1e98ce447a4e2.title: USN-4529-1: FreeImage vulnerabilities
892af39885712f42f283a57e40b1e98ce447a4e2.body: It was discovered that FreeImage incorrectly handled certain memory operations. (CVE-2019-13734, CVE-2019-13750, CVE-2019-13753) It was discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled certain corrupt records. An attacker could use this issue to cause SQLite to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-13751) It was discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled certain queries. An attacker could use this issue to cause SQLite to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 19.10. (CVE-2019-19880) It was discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled certain queries. An attacker could use this issue to cause SQLite to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 19.10. (CVE-2019-19923) It was discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled parser tree rewriting. An attacker could use this issue to cause SQLite to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 19.10. (CVE-2019-19924) It was discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled certain ZIP archives. An attacker could use this issue to cause SQLite to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 19.10. (CVE-2019-19925, CVE-2019-19959) It was discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled errors during parsing. An attacker could use this issue to cause SQLite to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-19926) It was discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled parsing errors. An attacker could use this issue to cause SQLite to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-20218) It was discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled generated column optimizations. An attacker could use this issue to cause SQLite to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 19.10. (CVE-2020-9327)

c3129f2335a922b3b63707eb96c29506c0690141.body: Youssouf Boulouiz discovered that SPIP incorrectly handled login error messages. A remote attacker could potentially exploit this to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. (CVE-2019-16392)

b236d74e489281da0ac1c397d23b9e4c5f8ba533.body: Gilles Vincent discovered that SPIP incorrectly handled password reset requests. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause SPIP to enumerate registered users. (CVE-2019-16394)

b6a28e8d4bf124a82799e176abd19992fc733089.body: Alexis Zucca discovered that SPIP incorrectly handled the media plugin. A remote authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to write to the database. (CVE-2019-19830)

8179f7b028152795d4adf4b2a3df42ea0593afe2.body: It was discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled certain queries. An attacker could use this issue to cause SQLite to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 19.10. (CVE-2019-19880)

77d0c1ff2ede719cae2d6a0eb61f5870617151a1.title: USN-4272-1: Pillow vulnerabilities
77d0c1ff2ede719cae2d6a0eb61f5870617151a1.body: It was discovered that Pillow incorrectly handled certain images. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2019-16865, CVE-2019-19911)

0be312422adedf2be816a9c4cec0019015a362d8.body: It was discovered that Exim SpamAssassin does not properly handle configuration strings. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-19920)

48a7c3493351c8e747596cf747d9e7ae032ff3af.body: It was discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled certain queries. ce1a7830331987e79e1be7b3902bbc2f7f4562ff.title: USN-4298-1: SQLite vulnerabilities
ce1a7830331987e79e1be7b3902bbc2f7f4562ff.body: It was discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled errors during parsing. An attacker could use this issue to cause SQLite to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-19926)

2de599f586277b55922d81e189f5d4267d3501db.body: It was discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled errors during parsing. An attacker could use this issue to cause SQLite to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-19926)

b7ff69c6f60a074633886bdd20efabbd7612cd98.body: It was discovered that ImageMagick incorrectly handled certain specially crafted image files. 879094529bea8e1cdbdaf838f19abd9a21973d09.body: It was discovered that Vim incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 19.10. (CVE-2019-20079)

070aa6e5c8cdfe2298dc0bd67fb6fa2e3f398869.body: It was discovered that the Empia EM28xx DVB USB device driver implementation in the Linux kernel contained a use-after-free vulnerability when disconnecting the device. 82dab0bde37af73d825ca995b8a764ba09d0366c.body: It was discovered that libbsd incorrectly handled certain strings. An attacker could possibly use this issue to access sensitive information. (CVE-2019-20367)

067789adc7798e2b91973ff5530ab5cb20ef0d8b.body: Multiple security issues were discovered in Firefox. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service, spoof the URL or other browser chrome, obtain sensitive information, bypass Content Security Policy (CSP) protections, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-20503, CVE-2020-6805, CVE-2020-6806, CVE-2020-6807, CVE-2020-6808, CVE-2020-6810, CVE-2020-6812, CVE-2020-6813, CVE-2020-6814, CVE-2020-6815)

ab1bb7552339e1621fa3399999f7604552f76bb4.title: USN-4328-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
ab1bb7552339e1621fa3399999f7604552f76bb4.body: Multiple security issues were discovered in Thunderbird. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website in a browsing context, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service, conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks, obtain sensitive information, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-20503, CVE-2020-6798, CVE-2020-6800, CVE-2020-6805, CVE-2020-6806, CVE-2020-6807, CVE-2020-6812, CVE-2020-6814, CVE-2020-6819, CVE-2020-6820, CVE-2020-6821, CVE-2020-6825)

05d0186aae07771b22e79be72585703fad9590e1.title: USN-4407-1: LibVNCServer vulnerabilities
05d0186aae07771b22e79be72585703fad9590e1.body: It was discovered that LibVNCServer incorrectly handled cursor shape updates. If a user were tricked in to connecting to a malicious server, an attacker could possibly use this issue to cause LibVNCServer to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 19.10, Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, and Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. (CVE-2019-15690, CVE-2019-20788)

dc535ec06cf5d95a2d3afad9c7a369079010b5f4.title: USN-4582-1: Vim vulnerabilities
dc535ec06cf5d95a2d3afad9c7a369079010b5f4.body: It was discovered that Vim incorrectly handled restricted mode. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass restricted mode and execute arbitrary commands. Note: This update only makes executing shell commands more difficult. Restricted mode should not be considered a complete security measure. (CVE-2019-20807)

022a493e328165a266a9d6e37e77e7ebb6186e8f.title: USN-4434-1: LibVNCServer vulnerabilities
022a493e328165a266a9d6e37e77e7ebb6186e8f.body: It was discovered that LibVNCServer did not properly access byte-aligned data. 1dd1109606e1317ad04a9c61e2383daf8deb0aae.body: It was discovered that Python incorrectly handled certain TAR archives. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2019-20907)

c120071d3895db02af05134a7ee8e40d5eb63dba.body: Jason A. Donenfeld discovered that the ACPI implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly restrict loading SSDT code from an EFI variable. c2679f4c7e8239f19a3380ba9d85cf47507b155c.body: It was discovered that CUPS incorrectly handled certain language values. 8feea89d69c410e9312fa1fd2272c3b9ebf19d4b.body: Michael Hanselmann discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled certain i2c commands. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to read QEMU process memory. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.10. (CVE-2019-3812)

5a1c57198663bce7ba262808ad0cedd3565fc668.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that GnuTLS incorrectly handled memory when verifying certain X.509 certificates. c39407f9c3e5072b42384d18c5e6c429ad186917.body: It was discovered that mod_auth_mellon incorrectly handled certain requests. An attacker could possibly use this issue to access sensitive information. (CVE-2019-3878)

6263cfa61efd095e9d88e326770758a5f5d0e745.body: It was discovered that libvirt incorrectly performed certain permission checks. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to access the guest agent and cause a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 19.04. (CVE-2019-3886)

8e309f0377b93ccdf35ccdd791d3acb3e731a20f.body: Mitchell Frank discovered that the Wi-Fi implementation in the Linux kernel when used as an access point would send IAPP location updates for stations before client authentication had completed. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2019-5108)

2fb191a8c6202078fbea851aea6d35d363400b64.body: It was discovered that the VLC AVI demuxer incorrectly handled certain files. 3b38e2a135c6a16414e99d794f9302810fa86b4c.body: It was discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled certain commands. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-5827)

776af5bea3b715521e34b3111342d750d216a55c.body: USN-3885-1 fixed vulnerabilities in OpenSSH. It was discovered that the fix for CVE-2019-6111 turned out to be incomplete. This update fixes the problem.

f97a676fda8ebd204f93bcef8c59deeb49798255.body: Details Harry Sintonen discovered multiple issues in the OpenSSH scp utility. If a user or automated system were tricked into connecting to an untrusted server, a remote attacker could possibly use these issues to write to arbitrary files, change directory permissions, and spoof client output.

163b866c7c4139b0153afea07a5244635e3e0725.title: USN-3964-1: python-gnupg vulnerabilities
163b866c7c4139b0153afea07a5244635e3e0725.body: It was discovered that python-gnupg incorrectly handled the GPG passphrase. A remote attacker could send a specially crafted passphrase that would allow them to control the output of encryption and decryption operations. (CVE-2019-6690)

1357065aa0642157211677cba516f274f60d0b37.title: USN-3923-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
1357065aa0642157211677cba516f274f60d0b37.body: It was discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled the Slirp networking back-end. An attacker inside the guest could use this issue to cause QEMU to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code on the host. In the default installation, when QEMU is used with libvirt, attackers would be isolated by the libvirt AppArmor profile. (CVE-2019-6778)

9c2d1942c6d3feeef6491c97f59b92ab19a38dac.title: USN-3932-2: Linux kernel (Xenial HWE) vulnerabilities
9c2d1942c6d3feeef6491c97f59b92ab19a38dac.body: Jim Mattson and Felix Wilhelm discovered a use-after-free vulnerability in the KVM subsystem of the Linux kernel, when using nested virtual machines. A local attacker in a guest VM could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code in the host system. (CVE-2019-7221)

A physically proximate attacker could use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2019-9506)

ef626cd4d0f1354a560ef2fbaac1a5bf45d54560.title: USN-4118-1: Linux kernel (AWS) vulnerabilities
ef626cd4d0f1354a560ef2fbaac1a5bf45d54560.body: Daniele Antonioli, Nils Ole Tippenhauer, and Kasper B. Rasmussen discovered that the Bluetooth protocol BR/EDR specification did not properly require sufficiently strong encryption key lengths. A physically proximate attacker could use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2019-9506)

7e8209c3a28c0b1257e2317a74d89ab992905937.title: USN-4147-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
7e8209c3a28c0b1257e2317a74d89ab992905937.body: Daniele Antonioli, Nils Ole Tippenhauer, and Kasper B. Rasmussen discovered that the Bluetooth protocol BR/EDR specification did not properly require sufficiently strong encryption key lengths. A physically proximate attacker could use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2019-9506)

3a6d7b349b3792418d18a86b473d247f532bbf22.title: USN-3922-1: PHP vulnerabilities
3a6d7b349b3792418d18a86b473d247f532bbf22.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2019-9637, CVE-2019-9638, CVE-2019-9639, CVE-2019-9640, CVE-2019-9641)

34b8fb3140038aee138b396548d213830d6164fc.title: USN-3922-2: PHP vulnerabilities
34b8fb3140038aee138b396548d213830d6164fc.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2019-9637, CVE-2019-9638, CVE-2019-9639, CVE-2019-9640, CVE-2019-9641)

05642717184b234f3a8419e0e04df4503bca5d08.title: USN-3922-3: PHP vulnerabilities
05642717184b234f3a8419e0e04df4503bca5d08.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2019-9637, CVE-2019-9638, CVE-2019-9639, CVE-2019-9640, CVE-2019-9641)

02c6658c8332d28ad84ca520f174c8c1b5f4a2d9.title: USN-4523-1: LibOFX vulnerability
02c6658c8332d28ad84ca520f174c8c1b5f4a2d9.body: It was discovered that LibOFX did not properly check for errors in certain situations, leading to a NULL pointer dereference. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause a denial of service attack. (CVE-2019-9656)

432c167ef3e91be1a0c7208586a726af6c4effe3.title: USN-3922-2: PHP vulnerabilities
432c167ef3e91be1a0c7208586a726af6c4effe3.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-9675)

8a093f0a22dc3335db87294d00971ab9866cf779.title: USN-3922-3: PHP vulnerabilities
8a093f0a22dc3335db87294d00971ab9866cf779.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-9675)

2db09442da3bebcf8af9eb096ed95e3cdba3120a.title: USN-4063-1: LibreOffice vulnerabilities
2db09442da3bebcf8af9eb096ed95e3cdba3120a.body: Nils Emmerich discovered that LibreOffice incorrectly handled LibreLogo scripts. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted document, a remote attacker could cause LibreOffice to execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-9848)

20ffa89fda0e9643140ee68f5c383eece486fe66.title: USN-4063-1: LibreOffice vulnerabilities
20ffa89fda0e9643140ee68f5c383eece486fe66.body: Matei "Mal" Badanoiu discovered that LibreOffice incorrectly handled stealth mode. Contrary to expectations, bullet graphics could be retrieved from remote locations when running in stealth mode. (CVE-2019-9849)

57733932934fd7a181f1de7fc45cd99f3d51c3b2.title: USN-4102-1: LibreOffice vulnerabilities
57733932934fd7a181f1de7fc45cd99f3d51c3b2.body: It was discovered that LibreOffice incorrectly handled LibreLogo scripts. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted document, a remote attacker could cause LibreOffice to execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-9850, CVE-2019-9851)

62caf69be76707ce8ba26c87e7dae08e7e577f6c.title: USN-4102-1: LibreOffice vulnerabilities
62caf69be76707ce8ba26c87e7dae08e7e577f6c.body: It was discovered that LibreOffice incorrectly handled embedded scripts in document files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted document, a remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2019-9852)

2104a087d8643f0619edc202f41d8e0ce2617ab2.title: USN-4019-1: SQLite vulnerabilities
2104a087d8643f0619edc202f41d8e0ce2617ab2.body: It was discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled certain queries. An attacker could possibly use this issue to access sensitive information. This issue only affected Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.10. (CVE-2019-9936)

c6baa39a0e2289b213f06130351c3e0997b582a0.title: USN-4019-1: SQLite vulnerabilities
c6baa39a0e2289b213f06130351c3e0997b582a0.body: It was discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a crash or execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.10. (CVE-2019-9937)

3877f99b5c64909cd312047d3d969d8a04f41f0e.title: USN-4127-2: Python vulnerabilities
3877f99b5c64909cd312047d3d969d8a04f41f0e.body: Sihoon Lee discovered that Python incorrectly handled the local_file: scheme. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass blacklist meschanisms. (CVE-2019-9948)

e83f616251c7e13fd343a12216006b4205b6460f.title: USN-4127-1: Python vulnerabilities
e83f616251c7e13fd343a12216006b4205b6460f.body: Sihoon Lee discovered that Python incorrectly handled the local_file: scheme. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass blacklist meschanisms. (CVE-2019-9948)

7ba44b7adbada07baa97e95ab9585b84a5b83efc.title: USN-4067-1: Evince vulnerability
7ba44b7adbada07baa97e95ab9585b84a5b83efc.body: Details It was discovered that Evince incorrectly handled certain PDF files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or to execute arbitrary code.

2bf5ac13e063d3e0d428ca38c9373d6f7d917cb9.title: USN-4081-1: Pango vulnerability
2bf5ac13e063d3e0d428ca38c9373d6f7d917cb9.body: Details It was discovered that Pango incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

4b2820788b7de72252267e4243695464e614a3d6.title: USN-4066-1: libmspack vulnerability
4b2820788b7de72252267e4243695464e614a3d6.body: Details It was discovered that libmspack incorrectly handled certain CHM files. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to access sensitive information.

3054df1c3534f6292b9a809700f7fb860bb43d96.title: USN-4066-2: ClamAV vulnerability
3054df1c3534f6292b9a809700f7fb860bb43d96.body: Details USN-4066-1 fixed a vulnerability in libmspack. This update provides the corresponding update for ClamAV in Ubuntu 12.04 ESM and Ubuntu 14.04 ESM. Original advisory details: It was discovered that ClamAV incorrectly handled certain CHM files. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to access sensitive information.

27fb5bfb604995b9b410b94774c6341f1451b7b7.title: USN-4010-1: Exim vulnerability
27fb5bfb604995b9b410b94774c6341f1451b7b7.body: Details It was discovered that Exim incorrectly handled certain decoding operations. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary commands.

1d9050c94139fdc8d47bacb3920964fb934703c3.title: USN-4047-2: libvirt update vulnerability
1d9050c94139fdc8d47bacb3920964fb934703c3.body: Details USN-4047-1 fixed a vulnerability in libvirt. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 14.04 ESM. Original advisory details: Matthias Gerstner and Ján Tomko discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled certain API calls. An attacker could possibly use this issue to check for arbitrary files, or execute arbitrary binaries. In the default installation, attackers would be isolated by the libvirt AppArmor profile.

36406e80a850bf87e6f52b2336a610c394cb8fe3.title: USN-4061-1: Redis vulnerabilities
36406e80a850bf87e6f52b2336a610c394cb8fe3.body: Details It was discovered that Redis incorrectly handled the hyperloglog data structure. An attacker could use this issue to cause Redis to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

58017749d6071659450e75aa2cfc439a49475dd5.title: USN-4121-1: Samba vulnerability
58017749d6071659450e75aa2cfc439a49475dd5.body: Details Stefan Metzmacher discovered that the Samba SMB server did not properly prevent clients from escaping outside the share root directory in some situations. An attacker could use this to gain access to files outside of the Samba share, where allowed by the permissions of the underlying filesystem.

ca0fd1c52f82e698de0e5fb63692a602f23aae43.title: USN-4087-1: BWA vulnerability
ca0fd1c52f82e698de0e5fb63692a602f23aae43.body: Details It was discovered that Burrows-Wheeler Aligner (BWA) mishandled certain crafted .alt files. An attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

986d4b4e0cd2632a154c8469b6483ffa477c457e.title: USN-4033-1: libmysofa vulnerability
986d4b4e0cd2632a154c8469b6483ffa477c457e.body: Details It was discovered that a libmysofa component does not properly validate multiplications and additions, and may crash with some specific input.

436fe2dbecf5a2810e43f24cd6d155521b899689.title: USN-3986-1: Wireshark vulnerabilities
436fe2dbecf5a2810e43f24cd6d155521b899689.body: Details It was discovered that Wireshark improperly handled certain input. A remote or local attacker could cause Wireshark to crash by injecting malform packets onto the wire or convincing someone to read a malformed packet trace file.

a4b729e35cd14595b8c5cc3309c10eb247f28bfa.title: USN-3953-1: PHP vulnerabilities
a4b729e35cd14595b8c5cc3309c10eb247f28bfa.body: Details It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain exif tags in JPEG images. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

fcb424bd25fae6faf4eb0b3075a4bf8000e7d082.title: USN-3953-2: PHP vulnerabilities
fcb424bd25fae6faf4eb0b3075a4bf8000e7d082.body: Details USN-3953-1 fixed several vulnerabilities in PHP. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM and Ubuntu 14.04 ESM. Original advisory details: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain exif tags in JPEG images. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

0a44cbd2cdb1cac4b522810745766fe92471e2e6.title: USN-4586-1: PHP ImageMagick vulnerability
0a44cbd2cdb1cac4b522810745766fe92471e2e6.body: Details It was discovered that PHP ImageMagick extension didn't check the address used by an array. An attacker could use this issue to cause PHP ImageMagick to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

dcda910b8cf1ea0422f2c679a32842e7413e62dc.title: USN-4166-1: PHP vulnerability
dcda910b8cf1ea0422f2c679a32842e7413e62dc.body: Details It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain paths when being used in FastCGI configurations. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

dca54fa545e23dbfec1e3f09e72397ffb1733ad2.title: USN-4166-2: PHP vulnerability
dca54fa545e23dbfec1e3f09e72397ffb1733ad2.body: Details USN-4166-1 fixed a vulnerability in PHP. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM and Ubuntu 14.04 ESM. Original advisory details: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain paths when being used in FastCGI configurations. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

d0a6ca712ac24f3c50d6f8ae6fa233e663989094.title: USN-4375-1: PHP vulnerability
d0a6ca712ac24f3c50d6f8ae6fa233e663989094.body: Details It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

e9db6b3b02d481b57f7c2314a4a5be77f58c0d60.title: USN-3988-1: MediaInfo vulnerabilities
e9db6b3b02d481b57f7c2314a4a5be77f58c0d60.body: Details It was discovered that MediaInfo contained multiple security issues when handling certain multimedia files. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted multimedia file, an attacker could cause MediaInfo to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

6241d4cbc7620662025fde0b02099bc980c52064.title: USN-3994-1: gnome-desktop vulnerability
6241d4cbc7620662025fde0b02099bc980c52064.body: Details It was discovered that gnome-desktop incorrectly confined thumbnailers. If a user were tricked into downloading a malicious image file, a remote attacker could possibly combine this issue with another vulnerability to escape the sandbox and execute arbitrary code.

e6695860c339807399fe4f62d630bef0ca975ba8.title: USN-4052-1: Whoopsie vulnerability
e6695860c339807399fe4f62d630bef0ca975ba8.body: Details Kevin Backhouse discovered Whoopsie incorrectly handled very large crash reports. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or expose sensitive information.

95102b9436e1e7e75d46ffa7db9087aef9f8e8aa.title: USN-4170-1: Whoopsie vulnerability
95102b9436e1e7e75d46ffa7db9087aef9f8e8aa.body: Details Kevin Backhouse discovered Whoopsie incorrectly handled very large crash reports. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service, expose sensitive information or execute code as the whoopsie user.

c0950f2e74ff8fbec89a4272a4ef2008291f79b8.title: USN-4170-2: Whoopsie regression
c0950f2e74ff8fbec89a4272a4ef2008291f79b8.body: Details USN-4170-1 fixed a vulnerability in Whoopsie. The update caused Whoopsie to crash when sending reports. This update fixes the problem. We apologize for the inconvenience. Original advisory details: Kevin Backhouse discovered Whoopsie incorrectly handled very large crash reports. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service, expose sensitive information or execute code as the whoopsie user.

5280ffb611681b2ab74b253b623240278cf79d7b.title: USN-3969-1: wpa_supplicant and hostapd vulnerability
5280ffb611681b2ab74b253b623240278cf79d7b.body: Details It was discovered that wpa_supplicant and hostapd incorrectly handled unexpected fragments when using EAP-pwd. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

fb8b4a5d7a8e104fd68251424835ce18ac1c2541.title: USN-3969-2: wpa_supplicant and hostapd vulnerability
fb8b4a5d7a8e104fd68251424835ce18ac1c2541.body: Details USN-3969-1 fixed a vulnerability in wpa_supplicant and hostapd. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 14.04 ESM. Original advisory details: It was discovered that wpa_supplicant and hostapd incorrectly handled unexpected fragments when using EAP-pwd. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

22d4bf17892ec47feb52517787009a53306f0c9c.title: USN-3963-1: Memcached vulnerability
22d4bf17892ec47feb52517787009a53306f0c9c.body: Details It was discovered that Memcached incorrectly handled certain lru command messages. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Memcached to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

fa4c9196c6e9e1206a571dcf552930901078db7f.title: USN-4133-1: Wireshark vulnerabilities
fa4c9196c6e9e1206a571dcf552930901078db7f.body: Details It was discovered that Wireshark improperly handled certain input. A remote or local attacker could cause Wireshark to crash by injecting malformed packets onto the wire or convincing someone to read a malformed packet trace file.

dcbdd6631a6edde7e5ba7169fdf2dd3951d75d91.title: USN-4044-1: ZNC vulnerability
dcbdd6631a6edde7e5ba7169fdf2dd3951d75d91.body: Details Fix vulnerability where an authenticated non-admin users could load a module with a crafted name, then escalate privileges and run arbitrary code.

59e874ba93161e244dd9db0f88361ea76a40cf2f.title: USN-4031-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
59e874ba93161e244dd9db0f88361ea76a40cf2f.body: Details It was discovered that the Linux kernel did not properly separate certain memory mappings when creating new userspace processes on 64-bit Power (ppc64el) systems. A local attacker could use this to access memory contents or cause memory corruption of other processes on the system.

e72e7be3faf2141cd82342dccf10f5014c450a2d.title: USN-4192-1: ImageMagick vulnerabilities
e72e7be3faf2141cd82342dccf10f5014c450a2d.body: Details It was discovered that ImageMagick incorrectly handled certain malformed image files. If a user or automated system using ImageMagick were tricked into opening a specially crafted image, an attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service or possibly execute code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.

be5c6c8dab84f669a24551d66c5b1136f3a2d996.title: USN-4050-1: ZeroMQ vulnerability
be5c6c8dab84f669a24551d66c5b1136f3a2d996.body: Details It was discovered that ZeroMQ incorrectly handled certain application metadata. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause ZeroMQ to crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

6dd37c201647b35c58268b30cdbee22a8892e8d2.title: USN-4088-1: PHP vulnerability
6dd37c201647b35c58268b30cdbee22a8892e8d2.body: Details It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled certain regular expressions. An attacker could possibly use this issue to expose sensitive information, cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code.

76abeeeb9d84def132a900fd59f0fc900c974645.title: USN-4098-1: wpa_supplicant and hostapd vulnerability
76abeeeb9d84def132a900fd59f0fc900c974645.body: Details It was discovered that wpa_supplicant and hostapd were vulnerable to a side channel attack against EAP-pwd. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to recover certain passwords.

90ccaec9414b866a5f126483ada147a1067b6700.title: USN-4173-1: FreeTDS vulnerability
90ccaec9414b866a5f126483ada147a1067b6700.body: Details Felix Wilhelm discovered that FreeTDS incorrectly handled certain types after a protocol downgrade. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause FreeTDS to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

4800eeac084eb1aa3497c129f22da26db131e5a9.title: USN-4073-1: libEBML vulnerability
4800eeac084eb1aa3497c129f22da26db131e5a9.body: Details It was discovered that libEBML incorrectly handled certain media files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted media file, libEBML could possibly be made to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

727236aabcee3a9ea799c684eda0efdb1e065da1.title: USN-4131-1: VLC vulnerabilities
727236aabcee3a9ea799c684eda0efdb1e065da1.body: Details It was discovered that VLC incorrectly handled certain media files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially-crafted file, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause VLC to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

0039b3a3555a4e1d4c171c70ab99be11f3b84df0.title: USN-4104-1: Nova vulnerability
0039b3a3555a4e1d4c171c70ab99be11f3b84df0.body: Details Donny Davis discovered that the Nova Compute service could return configuration or other information in response to a failed API request in some situations. A remote attacker could use this to expose sensitive information.

3978f8b665d8fcc5332eb9e4a9ab7b0529f16a19.title: USN-4085-1: Sigil vulnerability
3978f8b665d8fcc5332eb9e4a9ab7b0529f16a19.body: Details Mike Salvatore discovered that Sigil mishandled certain malformed EPUB files. An attacker could use this vulnerability to write arbitrary files to the filesystem.

d947b2812f5be1fe9adb0cad242ee5bc94a8606e.title: USN-4499-1: MilkyTracker vulnerabilities
d947b2812f5be1fe9adb0cad242ee5bc94a8606e.body: Details It was discovered that MilkyTracker did not properly handle certain input. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious file, an attacker could cause MilkyTracker to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code.

022a31def2d393f9bd9d95115d37636f984f5b6a.title: USN-4219-1: libssh vulnerability
022a31def2d393f9bd9d95115d37636f984f5b6a.body: Details It was discovered that libssh incorrectly handled certain scp commands. If a user or automated system were tricked into using a specially-crafted scp command, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary commands on the server.

1968f83db61d2cfc53d386562ea3fb5f890aa082.title: USN-4125-1: Memcached vulnerability
1968f83db61d2cfc53d386562ea3fb5f890aa082.body: Details It was discovered that Memcached incorrectly handled certain UNIX sockets. An attacker could possibly use this issue to access sensitive information.

e25eb3ffa961783856bfd62fac00ac532df9bf3a.title: USN-4198-1: DjVuLibre vulnerabilities
e25eb3ffa961783856bfd62fac00ac532df9bf3a.body: Details It was discovered that DjVuLibre incorrectly handled certain memory operations. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted DjVu file, a remote attacker could cause applications to hang or crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

0dfedbdbd2727328c79f2f8567c4cf95b0335bfd.title: USN-4119-1: Irssi vulnerability
0dfedbdbd2727328c79f2f8567c4cf95b0335bfd.body: Details It was discovered that Irssi incorrectly handled certain CAP requests. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code.

49418ba15a567b0c21423066220bd750d47e583c.title: USN-4139-1: File Roller vulnerability
49418ba15a567b0c21423066220bd750d47e583c.body: Details It was discovered that File Roller incorrectly handled certain TAR files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to overwrite sensitive files during extraction.

510e9513a56e1890cddacee24a2361a25a4af5a5.title: USN-4153-1: Octavia vulnerability
510e9513a56e1890cddacee24a2361a25a4af5a5.body: Details Daniel Preussker discovered that Octavia incorrectly handled client certificate checking. A remote attacker on the management network could possibly use this issue to perform configuration changes and obtain sensitive information.

7a84007914e80c1c5bb6fd19df7c95c3ebd63111.title: USN-4152-1: libsoup vulnerability
7a84007914e80c1c5bb6fd19df7c95c3ebd63111.body: Details It was discovered that libsoup incorrectly handled parsing certain NTLM messages. If a user or automated system were tricked into connecting to a malicious server, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

51b08886515a1f6af13c8ef5460438457d5a6e69.title: USN-4155-1: Aspell vulnerability
51b08886515a1f6af13c8ef5460438457d5a6e69.body: Details It was discovered that Aspell incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could potentially access sensitive information.

e62b0cad277c2031cd4a8f6e7f0945da86fdd672.title: USN-4155-2: Aspell vulnerability
e62b0cad277c2031cd4a8f6e7f0945da86fdd672.body: Details USN-4155-1 fixed a vulnerability in Aspell. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 19.10. Original advisory details: It was discovered that Aspell incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could potentially access sensitive information.

41f48061185ea0b1f52aca748fab5f12cc7c53b0.title: USN-4172-1: file vulnerability
41f48061185ea0b1f52aca748fab5f12cc7c53b0.body: Details It was discovered that file incorrectly handled certain malformed files. An attacker could use this issue to cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

49b5808d2d6092f491c9033ca032a77c1bbde9be.title: USN-4172-2: file vulnerability
49b5808d2d6092f491c9033ca032a77c1bbde9be.body: Details USN-4172-1 fixed a vulnerability in file. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM Ubuntu 14.04 ESM. Original advisory details: It was discovered that file incorrectly handled certain malformed files. An attacker could use this issue to cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

1ca1a7913c6d232c266ea2a4cb7de8778f408e70.title: USN-4169-1: libarchive vulnerability
1ca1a7913c6d232c266ea2a4cb7de8778f408e70.body: Details It was discovered that libarchive incorrectly handled certain archive files. An attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code.

405f5f517a802b3a94d3417bfd1c0994dc8ec0f0.title: USN-4214-1: RabbitMQ vulnerability
405f5f517a802b3a94d3417bfd1c0994dc8ec0f0.body: Details It was discovered that RabbitMQ incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

8cabf315fc6cc185f710921e44d81193d4308691.title: USN-4214-2: RabbitMQ vulnerability
8cabf315fc6cc185f710921e44d81193d4308691.body: Details USN-4214-1 fixed a vulnerability in RabbitMQ. This update provides the corresponding updates for Ubuntu 16.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.04 LTS. Original advisory details: It was discovered that RabbitMQ incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

66f4a447492bde4a5b4b1e380fae3a4cb54ccff9.title: USN-4263-1: Sudo vulnerability
66f4a447492bde4a5b4b1e380fae3a4cb54ccff9.body: Details Joe Vennix discovered that Sudo incorrectly handled memory operations when the pwfeedback option is enabled. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain unintended access to the administrator account.

fda12c005d472b437668c25bbcb8f1dd8d78db90.title: USN-4263-2: Sudo vulnerability
fda12c005d472b437668c25bbcb8f1dd8d78db90.body: Details USN-4263-1 fixed a vulnerability in Sudo. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM and Ubuntu 14.04 ESM. Original advisory details: Joe Vennix discovered that Sudo incorrectly handled memory operations when the pwfeedback option is enabled. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain unintended access to the administrator account.

d25e1f3cb7937bff6b8269584b869f04761b251b.title: USN-4571-1: rack-cors vulnerability
d25e1f3cb7937bff6b8269584b869f04761b251b.body: Details It was discovered that rack-cors did not properly handle relative file paths. An attacker could use this vulnerability to access arbitrary files.

29ebe7e0151162d15dec07b8e5aaa77ba62c8a28.title: USN-4256-1: Cyrus SASL vulnerability
29ebe7e0151162d15dec07b8e5aaa77ba62c8a28.body: Details It was discovered that Cyrus SASL incorrectly handled certain LDAP packets. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service.

2f048c10715b913e307b4d6fb2a093610a5fb72b.title: USN-4357-1: IPRoute vulnerability
2f048c10715b913e307b4d6fb2a093610a5fb72b.body: Details It was discovered that IPRoute incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

5b06897297a1df31c788a5db6335250d7a38c25c.title: USN-3946-1: rssh vulnerabilities
5b06897297a1df31c788a5db6335250d7a38c25c.body: Details It was discovered that rssh incorrectly handled certain command-line arguments and environment variables. An authenticated user could bypass rssh's command restrictions, allowing an attacker to run arbitrary commands.

b80121bbfc96d6b108260c00372394efb95425d5.title: USN-4194-2: postgresql-common vulnerability
b80121bbfc96d6b108260c00372394efb95425d5.body: Details USN-4194-1 fixed a vulnerability in postgresql-common. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 14.04 ESM. Original advisory details: Rich Mirch discovered that the postgresql-common pg_ctlcluster script incorrectly handled directory creation. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to escalate privileges.

f4eec05b6063e458bc6cdf90b15c70e5ad5b09c4.title: USN-3851-1: Django vulnerability
f4eec05b6063e458bc6cdf90b15c70e5ad5b09c4.body: Details It was discovered that Django incorrectly handled the default 404 page. A remote attacker could use this issue to spoof content using a malicious URL.

1af90481f10ce6dba0f8ebe45c30e9bb991497b3.title: USN-3870-1: Spice vulnerability
1af90481f10ce6dba0f8ebe45c30e9bb991497b3.body: Details Christophe Fergeau discovered that Spice incorrectly handled memory. A remote attacker could use this to cause Spice to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

d451977a472b42da14edc117ee4139606c42e857.title: USN-3966-1: GNOME Shell vulnerability
d451977a472b42da14edc117ee4139606c42e857.body: Details It was discovered that the GNOME Shell incorrectly handled certain keyboard inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to invoke keyboard shortcuts, and potentially other actions while the workstation was locked.

f623182298f520b335e14fb064b9fa23803ae079.title: USN-3895-1: LDB vulnerability
f623182298f520b335e14fb064b9fa23803ae079.body: Details It was discovered that LDB incorrectly handled certain search expressions. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause the Samba LDAP process to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

e8139f17000936c11b1c8638ffe0b5f8c5af2de8.title: USN-3892-1: GDM vulnerability
e8139f17000936c11b1c8638ffe0b5f8c5af2de8.body: Details Burghard Britzke discovered that GDM incorrectly handled certain configurations. An attacker could possibly use this issue to get unauthorized access to a different user.

3afec4686737a34685289b03396851871b8d10ac.title: USN-4142-2: e2fsprogs vulnerability
3afec4686737a34685289b03396851871b8d10ac.body: Details USN-4142-1 fixed a vulnerability in e2fsprogs. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM and Ubuntu 14.04 ESM. Original advisory details: It was discovered that e2fsprogs incorrectly handled certain ext4 partitions. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

a7130ded2ff5aa7007ab7512c8c65dee965ad451.title: USN-4142-1: e2fsprogs vulnerability
a7130ded2ff5aa7007ab7512c8c65dee965ad451.body: Details It was discovered that e2fsprogs incorrectly handled certain ext4 partitions. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

34d2443364024007e00704a53dddec907501ea23.title: USN-4249-1: e2fsprogs vulnerability
34d2443364024007e00704a53dddec907501ea23.body: Details It was discovered that e2fsprogs incorrectly handled certain ext4 partitions. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

aec02d021cb9ab6ef6bfff1805cf1e4003b475af.title: USN-4175-1: Nokogiri vulnerability
aec02d021cb9ab6ef6bfff1805cf1e4003b475af.body: Details It was discovered that Nokogiri incorrectly handled inputs. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary OS commands.

57f6c8d16bfb311d08cd4928d30bfaf7cadb3549.title: USN-4048-1: Docker vulnerabilities
57f6c8d16bfb311d08cd4928d30bfaf7cadb3549.body: Details Aleksa Sarai discovered that Docker was vulnerable to a directory traversal attack. An attacker could use this vulnerability to read and write arbitrary files on the host filesystem as root.

282129a8269e2c20cc99b11ddbea3354d65cf0e0.title: USN-3862-1: Irssi vulnerability
282129a8269e2c20cc99b11ddbea3354d65cf0e0.body: Details It was discovered that Irssi incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or to execute arbitrary code.

b887ff1aae060b442d2d49f84b1f74d70b2942b0.title: USN-3889-1: WebKitGTK+ vulnerabilities
b887ff1aae060b442d2d49f84b1f74d70b2942b0.body: Details A large number of security issues were discovered in the WebKitGTK+ Web and JavaScript engines. If a user were tricked into viewing a malicious website, a remote attacker could exploit a variety of issues related to web browser security, including cross-site scripting attacks, denial of service attacks, and arbitrary code execution.

2d2db7ce9273b7dd20d3a67c8946689fd5130373.title: USN-3891-1: systemd vulnerability
2d2db7ce9273b7dd20d3a67c8946689fd5130373.body: Details It was discovered that systemd incorrectly handled certain D-Bus messages. A local unprivileged attacker could exploit this in order to crash the init process, resulting in a system denial-of-service (kernel panic).

ee72f4d11f4f88f89393e00cacae8a6793caeb88.title: USN-3941-1: Lua vulnerability
ee72f4d11f4f88f89393e00cacae8a6793caeb88.body: Details Fady Othman discovered that Lua incorrectly handled certain scripts. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

f7681650c4a00f6bc2eca7ce8cf886c1e3b115ec.title: USN-3900-1: GD vulnerabilities
f7681650c4a00f6bc2eca7ce8cf886c1e3b115ec.body: Details It was discovered that GD incorrectly handled memory when processing certain images. A remote attacker could use this issue with a specially crafted image file to cause GD to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

d538d43ad8003848058fe87c5b1c90e6672ddbed.title: USN-3928-1: Dovecot vulnerability
d538d43ad8003848058fe87c5b1c90e6672ddbed.body: Details It was discovered that Dovecot incorrectly handled reading certain headers from the index. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to escalate privileges.

854bde5d46fa0457daf97ec9c6b703e006b2028a.title: USN-3948-1: WebKitGTK+ vulnerabilities
854bde5d46fa0457daf97ec9c6b703e006b2028a.body: Details A large number of security issues were discovered in the WebKitGTK+ Web and JavaScript engines. If a user were tricked into viewing a malicious website, a remote attacker could exploit a variety of issues related to web browser security, including cross-site scripting attacks, denial of service attacks, and arbitrary code execution.

aedfaf537f80399395a4f9688ca42c1c991f92c5.title: USN-3911-1: file vulnerabilities
aedfaf537f80399395a4f9688ca42c1c991f92c5.body: Details It was discovered that file incorrectly handled certain malformed ELF files. An attacker could use this issue to cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

e97ba95794bddb672a7766e68a1b989ab97857c9.title: USN-4563-1: NTP vulnerability
e97ba95794bddb672a7766e68a1b989ab97857c9.body: Details It was discovered that the fix for CVE-2018-7182 introduced a NULL pointer dereference into NTP. An attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service (crash).

b9026e02c2d27cead436f8a3bbcc4fc4afe620a1.title: USN-3905-1: poppler vulnerability
b9026e02c2d27cead436f8a3bbcc4fc4afe620a1.body: Details It was discovered that poppler incorrectly handled certain PDF files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

9e2eb42a156d7d805eb5ee332d2c09ef2803f358.title: USN-3936-1: AdvanceCOMP vulnerability
9e2eb42a156d7d805eb5ee332d2c09ef2803f358.body: Details It was discovered that AdvanceCOMP incorrectly handled certain PNG files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

a2d5a92b6f262bd2788a6285a732ec44dc1d725a.title: USN-3936-2: AdvanceCOMP vulnerability
a2d5a92b6f262bd2788a6285a732ec44dc1d725a.body: Details USN-3936-1 fixed a vulnerability in AdvanceCOMP. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 19.04. Original advisory details: It was discovered that AdvanceCOMP incorrectly handled certain PNG files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

d4ed3def738be4c98e181d32897b8587906e1e99.title: USN-3921-1: XMLTooling vulnerability
d4ed3def738be4c98e181d32897b8587906e1e99.body: Details It was discovered that XMLTooling incorrectly handled certain XML files with invalid data. An attacker could use this issue to cause XMLTooling to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

a0870ed99825583475ec83e41cd9368b2a8fa96d.title: USN-4138-1: LibreOffice vulnerability
a0870ed99825583475ec83e41cd9368b2a8fa96d.body: Details It was discovered that LibreOffice incorrectly handled embedded scripts in document files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted document, a remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code.

3dcd2cced6d1096d27165447b706889154069829.title: USN-3950-1: ZNC vulnerability
3dcd2cced6d1096d27165447b706889154069829.body: Details It was discovered that ZNC incorrectly handled certain invalid encodings. An authenticated remote user could use this issue to cause ZNC to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

8a0befefd96092468046248dc6dce8dbdc2eeb9e.title: USN-4058-1: Bash vulnerability
8a0befefd96092468046248dc6dce8dbdc2eeb9e.body: Details It was discovered that Bash incorrectly handled the restricted shell. An attacker could possibly use this issue to escape restrictions and execute any command.

ce446e6f80f2265b138b8516601f06677d9ed23d.title: USN-4058-2: Bash vulnerability
ce446e6f80f2265b138b8516601f06677d9ed23d.body: Details USN-4058-1 fixed a vulnerability in bash. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM and Ubuntu 14.04 ESM. Original advisory details: It was discovered that Bash incorrectly handled the restricted shell. An attacker could possibly use this issue to escape restrictions and execute any command.

c29d6070c0365e6cfad78fe17b54a388dbc69dd6.title: USN-3958-1: GStreamer Base Plugins vulnerability
c29d6070c0365e6cfad78fe17b54a388dbc69dd6.body: Details It was discovered that GStreamer Base Plugins did not correctly handle certain malformed RTSP streams. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted RTSP stream with a GStreamer application, an attacker could cause a denial of service via application crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

c14ed25916eb44cc8678875bfe7ad793be078b64.title: USN-4388-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
c14ed25916eb44cc8678875bfe7ad793be078b64.body: It was discovered that the F2FS file system implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly perform bounds checking on xattrs in some situations. A local attacker could possibly use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory). (CVE-2020-0067)

7a8ece0d15da02f7f96da7eae571e44750347e4a.title: USN-4389-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
7a8ece0d15da02f7f96da7eae571e44750347e4a.body: It was discovered that the F2FS file system implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly perform bounds checking on xattrs in some situations. A local attacker could possibly use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory). (CVE-2020-0067)

0b0b3b94b317afe96ab8e02e496b0e8a53f6eb27.title: USN-4387-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
0b0b3b94b317afe96ab8e02e496b0e8a53f6eb27.body: It was discovered that the F2FS file system implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly perform bounds checking on xattrs in some situations. A local attacker could possibly use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory). (CVE-2020-0067)

87f6add9d74df4a81f92ed21969cd89a1020eea3.title: USN-4390-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
87f6add9d74df4a81f92ed21969cd89a1020eea3.body: It was discovered that the F2FS file system implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly perform bounds checking on xattrs in some situations. 8e56aa919db4c919a4277e86dcfba04df187af91.title: USN-4527-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
8e56aa919db4c919a4277e86dcfba04df187af91.body: It was discovered that the F2FS file system implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly perform bounds checking on xattrs in some situations. A local attacker could possibly use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory). (CVE-2020-0067)

a0ca08628f9748c7636d9c1b4ba227c28e426306.title: USN-4396-1: libexif vulnerabilities
a0ca08628f9748c7636d9c1b4ba227c28e426306.body: It was discovered that libexif incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2020-0093, CVE-2020-0182)

a73daa8db07439a31783e0ddd4506e0ce0171285.title: USN-4396-1: libexif vulnerabilities
a73daa8db07439a31783e0ddd4506e0ce0171285.body: It was discovered that libexif incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a remote denial of service. (CVE-2020-0198)

48938863e91dbad4114872b07f49394de9c3c16a.title: USN-4385-1: Intel Microcode vulnerabilities
48938863e91dbad4114872b07f49394de9c3c16a.body: It was discovered that memory contents previously stored in microarchitectural special registers after RDRAND, RDSEED, and SGX EGETKEY read operations on Intel client and Xeon E3 processors may be briefly exposed to processes on the same or different processor cores. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2020-0543)

d1a9daafff2563f23cbb88965abb8bb949a77e85.title: USN-4388-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
d1a9daafff2563f23cbb88965abb8bb949a77e85.body: It was discovered that memory contents previously stored in microarchitectural special registers after RDRAND, RDSEED, and SGX EGETKEY read operations on Intel client and Xeon E3 processors may be briefly exposed to processes on the same or different processor cores. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2020-0543)

5eed513729145ce718f9742312b7dd0892166ec7.title: USN-4392-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
5eed513729145ce718f9742312b7dd0892166ec7.body: It was discovered that memory contents previously stored in microarchitectural special registers after RDRAND, RDSEED, and SGX EGETKEY read operations on Intel client and Xeon E3 processors may be briefly exposed to processes on the same or different processor cores. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2020-0543)

a98f149b4fc1416e1bb5286e984607fa7da2d17a.body: It was discovered that memory contents previously stored in microarchitectural special registers after RDRAND, RDSEED, and SGX EGETKEY read operations on Intel client and Xeon E3 processors may be briefly exposed to processes on the same or different processor cores. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2020-0543)

6cb187cbb2d5a2ca17b93250471b4952d618b52d.body: It was discovered that memory contents previously stored in microarchitectural special registers after RDRAND, RDSEED, and SGX EGETKEY read operations on Intel client and Xeon E3 processors may be briefly exposed to processes on the same or different processor cores.
