A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2020-0543)

4e4aee301361c3b610e93c66c54771c7d5b5e17d.title: USN-4391-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
4e4aee301361c3b610e93c66c54771c7d5b5e17d.body: It was discovered that memory contents previously stored in microarchitectural special registers after RDRAND, RDSEED, and SGX EGETKEY read operations on Intel client and Xeon E3 processors may be briefly exposed to processes on the same or different processor cores. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2020-0543)

59f46622bc82274d84bc3dcaf0c6ef29e27cc687.title: USN-4385-1: Intel Microcode vulnerabilities
59f46622bc82274d84bc3dcaf0c6ef29e27cc687.body: It was discovered that on some Intel processors, partial data values previously read from a vector register on a physical core may be propagated into unused portions of the store buffer. A local attacker could possible use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2020-0548)

9726c52a7a1cc9d3173321585e907fbf30c13ef6.title: USN-4385-1: Intel Microcode vulnerabilities
9726c52a7a1cc9d3173321585e907fbf30c13ef6.body: It was discovered that on some Intel processors, data from the most recently evicted modified L1 data cache (L1D) line may be propagated into an unused (invalid) L1D fill buffer. A local attacker could possibly use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2020-0549)

d26d6797abc45e33098f01ce0b60b53e0717ccee.title: USN-4311-1: BlueZ vulnerabilities
d26d6797abc45e33098f01ce0b60b53e0717ccee.body: It was discovered that BlueZ incorrectly handled bonding HID and HOGP devices. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to impersonate non-bonded devices. (CVE-2020-0556)

4e618b65751fc222a4e2333a4790315a31834d01.title: USN-4416-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
4e618b65751fc222a4e2333a4790315a31834d01.body: It was discovered that the GNU C Library incorrectly handled certain bit patterns. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the GNU C Library to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 16.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.04 LTS. (CVE-2020-10029)

c0de81ba9fc9db0176f48c761d9f185b0f5f81d5.title: USN-4308-1: Twisted vulnerabilities
c0de81ba9fc9db0176f48c761d9f185b0f5f81d5.body: Jake Miller and ZeddYu Lu discovered that Twisted incorrectly handled certain content-length headers. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to perform HTTP request splitting attacks. (CVE-2020-10108, CVE-2020-10109)

9eb2c9ae597785ca5fe90fed2a1954223e6ff2ac.title: USN-4308-2: Twisted vulnerabilities
9eb2c9ae597785ca5fe90fed2a1954223e6ff2ac.body: Jake Miller and ZeddYu Lu discovered that Twisted incorrectly handled certain content-length headers. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to perform HTTP request splitting attacks. (CVE-2020-10108, CVE-2020-10109)

311c53f92c20c218733cd7a19528dd53e9ad205b.title: USN-4419-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
311c53f92c20c218733cd7a19528dd53e9ad205b.body: It was discovered that a race condition existed in the Precision Time Protocol (PTP) implementation in the Linux kernel, leading to a use-after- free vulnerability. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2020-10690)

3ec2ca9e7a3375b925f6e9302c017b80dbcb0bfd.title: USN-4413-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
3ec2ca9e7a3375b925f6e9302c017b80dbcb0bfd.body: Matthew Sheets discovered that the SELinux network label handling implementation in the Linux kernel could be coerced into de-referencing a NULL pointer. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2020-10711)

4492ff86c5be22a8325754ba2366ed077da71eee.title: USN-4411-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
4492ff86c5be22a8325754ba2366ed077da71eee.body: Matthew Sheets discovered that the SELinux network label handling implementation in the Linux kernel could be coerced into de-referencing a NULL pointer. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2020-10711)

2694931859bd916fb41bc45bd370aeb1bbb9e4d4.body: Matthew Sheets discovered that the SELinux network label handling implementation in the Linux kernel could be coerced into de-referencing a NULL pointer. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2020-10711)

3838d7b3c91f26a14ad10c9504d0831f4ed16118.title: USN-4414-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
3838d7b3c91f26a14ad10c9504d0831f4ed16118.body: Matthew Sheets discovered that the SELinux network label handling implementation in the Linux kernel could be coerced into de-referencing a NULL pointer. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2020-10711)

0c02d0bba72b30c3cfc93e9d895a5b2a39d2dcb2.title: USN-4362-1: DPDK vulnerabilities
0c02d0bba72b30c3cfc93e9d895a5b2a39d2dcb2.body: It was discovered that DPDK incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a crash or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2020-10722, CVE-2020-10723, CVE-2020-10724, CVE-2020-10725, CVE-2020-10726)

48cd41a3565142ba2c91a5ee200d3753054c92b7.title: USN-4411-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
48cd41a3565142ba2c91a5ee200d3753054c92b7.body: It was discovered that the elf handling code in the Linux kernel did not initialize memory before using it in certain situations. A local attacker could use this to possibly expose sensitive information (kernel memory). (CVE-2020-10732)

3e41c572539230250c42a10f7184584209c54649.title: USN-4427-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
3e41c572539230250c42a10f7184584209c54649.body: It was discovered that the elf handling code in the Linux kernel did not initialize memory before using it in certain situations. A local attacker could use this to possibly expose sensitive information (kernel memory). (CVE-2020-10732)

7803ccc9678de9a0f9a5c55be7726cc7483264f5.title: USN-4439-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
7803ccc9678de9a0f9a5c55be7726cc7483264f5.body: It was discovered that the elf handling code in the Linux kernel did not initialize memory before using it in certain situations. A local attacker could use this to possibly expose sensitive information (kernel memory). (CVE-2020-10732)

636418e8907182f0a91ea7c152fd57cd950c8bbe.title: USN-4440-1: linux kernel vulnerabilities
636418e8907182f0a91ea7c152fd57cd950c8bbe.body: It was discovered that the elf handling code in the Linux kernel did not initialize memory before using it in certain situations. A local attacker could use this to possibly expose sensitive information (kernel memory). (CVE-2020-10732)

255ff525f757fe1b808bb417db488536d1defc07.title: USN-4485-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
255ff525f757fe1b808bb417db488536d1defc07.body: It was discovered that the elf handling code in the Linux kernel did not initialize memory before using it in certain situations. A local attacker could use this to possibly expose sensitive information (kernel memory). (CVE-2020-10732)

11c9a6257c7753236c2861e4fa5f6df5feb937ea.title: USN-4467-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
11c9a6257c7753236c2861e4fa5f6df5feb937ea.body: Ziming Zhang and VictorV discovered that the QEMU SLiRP networking implementation incorrectly handled replying to certain ICMP echo requests. 07c2a36412b68947cb3f918d57b71a198a6f4c9b.body: It was discovered that OpenStack Keystone incorrectly handled EC2 credentials. An authenticated attacker with a limited scope could possibly create EC2 credentials with escalated permissions. (CVE-2020-12689, CVE-2020-12691)

1e8429b31072499d1fbc3f25a5df65d9a9f4e2f3.title: USN-4360-4: json-c vulnerability
1e8429b31072499d1fbc3f25a5df65d9a9f4e2f3.body: USN-4360-1 fixed a vulnerability in json-c. The security fix introduced a memory leak that was reverted in USN-4360-2 and USN-4360-3. This update provides the correct fix update for CVE-2020-12762.

7e70f73bce188216b35a82d520a812f722dc76a9.title: USN-4360-1: json-c vulnerability
7e70f73bce188216b35a82d520a812f722dc76a9.body: Details It was discovered that json-c incorrectly handled certain JSON files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

a714a966a4c527f3c2a160413abbf4f552706a55.title: USN-4391-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
a714a966a4c527f3c2a160413abbf4f552706a55.body: It was discovered that the exit signaling implementation in the Linux kernel contained an integer overflow. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (arbitrary application crash). (CVE-2020-12826)

d74a33d5368784dfcd3e5817cb599d42138b2240.title: USN-4367-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
d74a33d5368784dfcd3e5817cb599d42138b2240.body: Details It was discovered that the btrfs implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly detect that a block was marked dirty in some situations. An attacker could use this to specially craft a file system image that, when unmounted, could cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2019-19377) It was discovered that the linux kernel did not properly validate certain mount options to the tmpfs virtual memory file system. A local attacker with the ability to specify mount options could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2020-11565) It was discovered that the block layer in the Linux kernel contained a race condition leading to a use-after-free vulnerability. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2020-12657)

98f65351ca043636c8a205fea36073839552d449.title: USN-4369-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
98f65351ca043636c8a205fea36073839552d449.body: Details It was discovered that the btrfs implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly detect that a block was marked dirty in some situations. An attacker could use this to specially craft a file system image that, when unmounted, could cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2019-19377) Tristan Madani discovered that the file locking implementation in the Linux kernel contained a race condition. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service or expose sensitive information. (CVE-2019-19769) It was discovered that the Serial CAN interface driver in the Linux kernel did not properly initialize data. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory). (CVE-2020-11494) It was discovered that the linux kernel did not properly validate certain mount options to the tmpfs virtual memory file system. A local attacker with the ability to specify mount options could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2020-11565) It was discovered that the OV51x USB Camera device driver in the Linux kernel did not properly validate device metadata. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2020-11608) It was discovered that the STV06XX USB Camera device driver in the Linux kernel did not properly validate device metadata. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2020-11609) It was discovered that the Xirlink C-It USB Camera device driver in the Linux kernel did not properly validate device metadata. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2020-11668) It was discovered that the block layer in the Linux kernel contained a race condition leading to a use-after-free vulnerability. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2020-12657)

f27cd64000f3b6dc193a2ca2498982a97e690fc0.body: It was discovered that Mutt incorrectly handled certain requests. An attacker could possibly use this issue to enable MITM attacks. (CVE-2020-14093)

2e510b3d6dad813a3688b5e37dde8ecae69d6f1e.title: USN-4432-1: GRUB 2 vulnerabilities
2e510b3d6dad813a3688b5e37dde8ecae69d6f1e.body: It was discovered that the memory allocator for GRUB2 did not validate allocation size, resulting in multiple integer overflows and heap-based buffer overflows when handling certain filesystems, PNG images or disk metadata. A local attacker could use this to execute arbitrary code and bypass UEFI Secure Boot restrictions. (CVE-2020-14308)

39916dafd80f81fa28f50ccde07511f91b8aa558.title: USN-4432-1: GRUB 2 vulnerabilities
39916dafd80f81fa28f50ccde07511f91b8aa558.body: Chris Coulson discovered that multiple integer overflows existed in GRUB2 when handling certain filesystems or font files, leading to heap-based buffer overflows. A local attacker could use these to execute arbitrary code and bypass UEFI Secure Boot restrictions. (CVE-2020-14309, CVE-2020-14310, CVE-2020-14311)

e93f8eb45e9224c9a3f2f9f807c86815402b58be.body: Jay Shin discovered that the ext4 file system implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly handle directory access with broken indexing, leading to an out-of-bounds read vulnerability. a6afc04fea17d94a95e9cc444f600847de37158f.title: USN-4434-1: LibVNCServer vulnerabilities
a6afc04fea17d94a95e9cc444f600847de37158f.body: Christian Beier discovered that LibVNCServer incorrectly handled anonymous TLS connections. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause LibVNCServer to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. (CVE-2020-14396)

85158625a2d9951a197e6da0f4de8723bc150723.title: USN-4434-1: LibVNCServer vulnerabilities
85158625a2d9951a197e6da0f4de8723bc150723.body: It was discovered that LibVNCServer incorrectly handled region clipping. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause LibVNCServer to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2020-14397)

668b018ee333f7f71447b93ae81e19310ee78823.title: USN-4573-1: Vino vulnerabilities
668b018ee333f7f71447b93ae81e19310ee78823.body: It was discovered that Vino incorrectly handled region clipping. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Vino to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2020-14397)

1665864c29ddca5a773948ef9e3479518e2ff1b6.title: USN-4434-1: LibVNCServer vulnerabilities
1665864c29ddca5a773948ef9e3479518e2ff1b6.body: It was discovered that LibVNCServer incorrectly handled screen scaling on the server side. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause LibVNCServer to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2020-14401)

2bd8b8e7dfbd634758546a72ca111616120e0a7f.title: USN-4434-1: LibVNCServer vulnerabilities
2bd8b8e7dfbd634758546a72ca111616120e0a7f.body: It was discovered that LibVNCServer incorrectly handled encodings. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause LibVNCServer to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2020-14402, CVE-2020-14403, CVE-2020-14404)

4a1423b6cffaada1fba617aeec8ef4972da0004e.title: USN-4573-1: Vino vulnerabilities
4a1423b6cffaada1fba617aeec8ef4972da0004e.body: It was discovered that Vino incorrectly handled encodings. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Vino to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2020-14402, CVE-2020-14403, CVE-2020-14404)

68938abc0e068248ec613ffa3aa3ab52c4ea4099.title: USN-4559-1: Samba update
68938abc0e068248ec613ffa3aa3ab52c4ea4099.body: For compatibility reasons with older devices, Samba now allows specifying an insecure netlogon configuration per machine. See the following link for examples: https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2020-1472.html

b597a2855e42deddd22759c87f19456f87871ee3.title: USN-4510-1: Samba vulnerability
b597a2855e42deddd22759c87f19456f87871ee3.body: Details Tom Tervoort discovered that the Netlogon protocol implemented by Samba incorrectly handled the authentication scheme. A remote attacker could use this issue to forge an authentication token and steal the credentials of the domain admin. This update fixes the issue by changing the "server schannel" setting to default to "yes", instead of "auto", which will force a secure netlogon channel. This may result in compatibility issues with older devices. A future update may allow a finer-grained control over this setting.

c206849d199421100b8a3d9780d8e1daf28ca78a.title: USN-4510-2: Samba vulnerability
c206849d199421100b8a3d9780d8e1daf28ca78a.body: Details USN-4510-1 fixed a vulnerability in Samba. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 14.04 ESM. Original advisory details: Tom Tervoort discovered that the Netlogon protocol implemented by Samba incorrectly handled the authentication scheme. A remote attacker could use this issue to forge an authentication token and steal the credentials of the domain admin. This update fixes the issue by changing the "server schannel" setting to default to "yes", instead of "auto", which will force a secure netlogon channel. This may result in compatibility issues with older devices. A future update may allow a finer-grained control over this setting.

203d8dff1191a1f038c26b80daaf16fa0cb41d6e.title: USN-4443-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
203d8dff1191a1f038c26b80daaf16fa0cb41d6e.body: It was discovered that redirected HTTP requests which are observed or modified through a web extension could bypass existing CORS checks. If a user were tricked in to installing a specially crafted extension, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information across origins. (CVE-2020-15655)

e2e3d4fafcb6f487646ce04377c025cda8592b12.title: USN-4443-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
e2e3d4fafcb6f487646ce04377c025cda8592b12.body: Multiple security issues were discovered in Firefox. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service, obtain sensitive information, bypass iframe sandbox restrictions, confuse the user, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2020-6463, CVE-2020-6514, CVE-2020-15652, CVE-2020-15653, CVE-2020-15654, CVE-2020-15656, CVE-2020-15658, CVE-2020-15659)

e350d6ac54c8c22f9d241244e2c7f08293cd6d96.title: USN-4432-1: GRUB 2 vulnerabilities
e350d6ac54c8c22f9d241244e2c7f08293cd6d96.body: Chris Coulson discovered that the GRUB2 function handling code did not properly handle a function being redefined, leading to a use-after-free vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to execute arbitrary code and bypass UEFI Secure Boot restrictions. (CVE-2020-15706)

58016be2e7215c90bcecbcd384b1c61d38de4cc8.title: USN-4471-1: Net-SNMP vulnerabilities
58016be2e7215c90bcecbcd384b1c61d38de4cc8.body: It was discovered that Net-SNMP incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 ESM, Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, and Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. (CVE-2020-15862)

4d8545d28c0e7cf3630963efc085b76869151148.title: USN-4467-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
4d8545d28c0e7cf3630963efc085b76869151148.body: Ziming Zhang discovered that the QEMU XGMAC Ethernet controller incorrectly handled packet transmission. An attacker inside a guest could use this issue to cause QEMU to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2020-15863)

216053b2b9af7e9ddaeafe4bb9415eb9f174c700.title: USN-4501-1: LuaJIT vulnerability
216053b2b9af7e9ddaeafe4bb9415eb9f174c700.body: It was discovered that an out-of-bounds read existed in LuaJIT. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly expose sensitive information. (CVE-2020-15890)

45be750b5e8bc1b4bc01a4c344b4b5005c4e6a14.body: It was discovered that the state of network RNG in the Linux kernel was potentially observable. A remote attacker could use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2020-16166)

e6ac52b47b43ef60f68bddc94ce1114ee4b61ed5.body: It was discovered that the GNU C Library incorrectly handled tilde expansion. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the GNU C Library to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2020-1752)

88e968885c44f5b7642af13e7ea42fdf018a77c4.body: Al Viro discovered that the vfs layer in the Linux kernel contained a use- after-free vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly expose sensitive information (kernel memory). (CVE-2020-8428)

89cd2a4a1300febc02550e2650994aec28ccbd60.title: USN-4320-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
89cd2a4a1300febc02550e2650994aec28ccbd60.body: Details Al Viro discovered that the vfs layer in the Linux kernel contained a use- after-free vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly expose sensitive information (kernel memory).

5a72462c927418fe4780c3259b8733f9e0683ede.title: USN-4289-1: Squid vulnerabilities
5a72462c927418fe4780c3259b8733f9e0683ede.body: Guido Vranken discovered that Squid incorrectly handled certain buffer operations when acting as a reverse proxy. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Squid to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2020-8450)

4055403032eeb9db7239acd628ebf01ce82257f0.title: USN-4289-1: Squid vulnerabilities
4055403032eeb9db7239acd628ebf01ce82257f0.body: Aaron Costello discovered that Squid incorrectly handled certain NTLM authentication credentials. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Squid to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2020-8517)

be3d0b24262534ae0d40a85bced4456be86e9f16.title: USN-4468-1: Bind vulnerabilities
be3d0b24262534ae0d40a85bced4456be86e9f16.body: Joseph Gullo discovered that Bind incorrectly handled QNAME minimization when used in certain configurations. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Bind to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. (CVE-2020-8621)

21f86e5572401784fa398bd691bb32647aae3963.title: USN-4468-1: Bind vulnerabilities
21f86e5572401784fa398bd691bb32647aae3963.body: Lyu Chiy discovered that Bind incorrectly handled certain queries. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Bind to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2020-8623)

ae93b2725d4e4f1e57edbc2c9121c1c06242393c.title: USN-4468-1: Bind vulnerabilities
ae93b2725d4e4f1e57edbc2c9121c1c06242393c.body: Joop Boonen discovered that Bind incorrectly handled certain subdomain update-policy rules. A remote attacker granted privileges to change certain parts of a zone could use this issue to change other contents of the zone, contrary to expectations. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. (CVE-2020-8624)

d5b0f91846eb81f2d4852f4f84441b6599e1c06a.title: USN-4344-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
d5b0f91846eb81f2d4852f4f84441b6599e1c06a.body: It was discovered that the virtual terminal implementation in the Linux kernel contained a race condition. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or expose sensitive information. (CVE-2020-8648)

f5f5c5845271a95b6a8aa289d5c4856573a8fe32.title: USN-4345-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
f5f5c5845271a95b6a8aa289d5c4856573a8fe32.body: It was discovered that the virtual terminal implementation in the Linux kernel contained a race condition. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or expose sensitive information. (CVE-2020-8648)

8bddda5b58a5bfaf95bba70b7a107f47d88c1f34.title: USN-4342-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
8bddda5b58a5bfaf95bba70b7a107f47d88c1f34.body: It was discovered that the virtual terminal implementation in the Linux kernel contained a race condition. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or expose sensitive information. (CVE-2020-8648)

7edf4165b5e2f5acd9ff5fed1645d2c6d409e607.title: USN-4346-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
7edf4165b5e2f5acd9ff5fed1645d2c6d409e607.body: It was discovered that the virtual terminal implementation in the Linux kernel contained a race condition. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or expose sensitive information. (CVE-2020-8648)

c885b9723ab2deff13e0ee4c709f9a19190a8338.title: USN-4294-1: OpenSMTPD vulnerabilities
c885b9723ab2deff13e0ee4c709f9a19190a8338.body: It was discovered that OpenSMTPD mishandled certain input. A remote, unauthenticated attacker could use this vulnerability to execute arbitrary shell commands as any non-root user. (CVE-2020-8794)

bfeba1c7f5002acdfed7c009c26f2d0ebdbb59b5.title: USN-4302-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
bfeba1c7f5002acdfed7c009c26f2d0ebdbb59b5.body: Gregory Herrero discovered that the fix for CVE-2019-14615 to address the Linux kernel not properly clearing data structures on context switches for certain Intel graphics processors was incomplete. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information. (CVE-2020-8832)

2e71f4d621ead3fe3e1297414c2827c5d19bfc58.title: USN-4293-1: libarchive vulnerabilities
2e71f4d621ead3fe3e1297414c2827c5d19bfc58.body: It was discovered that libarchive incorrectly handled certain archive files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a crash resulting in a denial of service or possibly unspecified other impact. This issue only affected Ubuntu 19.10. (CVE-2020-9308)

de63d743ac0dc447fd26ba7bd6108c67412a651f.title: USN-4298-1: SQLite vulnerabilities
de63d743ac0dc447fd26ba7bd6108c67412a651f.body: It was discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled generated column optimizations. An attacker could use this issue to cause SQLite to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 19.10. (CVE-2020-9327)

47e7eb8a98e0322cf27913474a16e80c98f91286.title: USN-4344-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
47e7eb8a98e0322cf27913474a16e80c98f91286.body: Jordy Zomer discovered that the floppy driver in the Linux kernel did not properly check for errors in some situations. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly expose sensitive information. (CVE-2020-9383)

f1203594f3117ff94440e84d31d3c3cc3c6dfc04.title: USN-4345-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
f1203594f3117ff94440e84d31d3c3cc3c6dfc04.body: Jordy Zomer discovered that the floppy driver in the Linux kernel did not properly check for errors in some situations. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly expose sensitive information. (CVE-2020-9383)

e7fc7b083abdafc5ed274b9539900952855b8a73.title: USN-4342-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
e7fc7b083abdafc5ed274b9539900952855b8a73.body: Jordy Zomer discovered that the floppy driver in the Linux kernel did not properly check for errors in some situations. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly expose sensitive information. (CVE-2020-9383)

0dafd01227501bd36db7d5b38c8598f8401aadcd.title: USN-4346-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
0dafd01227501bd36db7d5b38c8598f8401aadcd.body: Jordy Zomer discovered that the floppy driver in the Linux kernel did not properly check for errors in some situations. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly expose sensitive information. (CVE-2020-9383)

0588403e10707d2ec4855e98df32bb1c0412557c.title: USN-4310-1: WebKitGTK+ vulnerability
0588403e10707d2ec4855e98df32bb1c0412557c.body: Details A large number of security issues were discovered in the WebKitGTK+ Web and JavaScript engines. If a user were tricked into viewing a malicious website, a remote attacker could exploit a variety of issues related to web browser security, including cross-site scripting attacks, denial of service attacks, and arbitrary code execution.

ea87145b2aff35cb84b928add6bdc5d0396e6879.title: USN-4430-1: Pillow vulnerabilities
ea87145b2aff35cb84b928add6bdc5d0396e6879.body: Details It was discovered that Pillow incorrectly handled certain image files. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially-crafted image file, a remote attacker could possibly cause Pillow to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

9f1a9df3b6c4d4a506082309fb040285352dc1aa.title: USN-4430-2: Pillow vulnerabilities
9f1a9df3b6c4d4a506082309fb040285352dc1aa.body: Details USN-4430-1 fixed vulnerabilities in Pillow. This update provides the corresponding updates for Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. Original advisory details: It was discovered that Pillow incorrectly handled certain image files. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially-crafted image file, a remote attacker could possibly cause Pillow to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

8edb01cb2ac0571d1a1d2288e900711676e7a3cd.title: USN-4305-1: ICU vulnerability
8edb01cb2ac0571d1a1d2288e900711676e7a3cd.body: Details André Bargull discovered that ICU incorrectly handled certain strings. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

a828d1b813e1b3d7d2acbcb149f7cc05010ec1e1.title: USN-4382-1: FreeRDP vulnerabilities
a828d1b813e1b3d7d2acbcb149f7cc05010ec1e1.body: Details It was discovered that FreeRDP incorrectly handled certain memory operations. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause FreeRDP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

acf5999409e798d619810369f38d4b9195e893ed.title: USN-4481-1: FreeRDP vulnerabilities
acf5999409e798d619810369f38d4b9195e893ed.body: Details It was discovered that FreeRDP incorrectly handled certain memory operations. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause FreeRDP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

eb9a46103872cadcd651c6fde2e0d1279627e889.title: USN-4321-1: HAProxy vulnerability
eb9a46103872cadcd651c6fde2e0d1279627e889.body: Details Felix Wilhelm discovered that HAProxy incorrectly handled certain HTTP/2 requests. An attacker could possibly use this to execute arbitrary code.

09fc24b711e9d0ac8a727d24546a3d714213274e.title: USN-4332-1: File Roller vulnerability
09fc24b711e9d0ac8a727d24546a3d714213274e.body: Details It was discovered that File Roller incorrectly handled symlinks. An attacker could possibly use this issue to expose sensitive information.

ef534aa47c6c17eb8561ced256215b4703a55989.title: USN-4332-2: File Roller vulnerability
ef534aa47c6c17eb8561ced256215b4703a55989.body: Details USN-4332-1 fixed vulnerabilities in File Roller. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. Original advisory details: It was discovered that File Roller incorrectly handled symlinks. An attacker could possibly use this issue to expose sensitive information.

a3b55fb7367158f025ced89c9c446523978db3fa.title: USN-4331-1: WebKitGTK+ vulnerability
a3b55fb7367158f025ced89c9c446523978db3fa.body: Details A large number of security issues were discovered in the WebKitGTK+ Web and JavaScript engines. If a user were tricked into viewing a malicious website, a remote attacker could exploit a variety of issues related to web browser security, including cross-site scripting attacks, denial of service attacks, and arbitrary code execution.

1512b959864595efa6e415cea74cd3a2d0f5d854.title: USN-4338-1: re2c vulnerability
1512b959864595efa6e415cea74cd3a2d0f5d854.body: Details Agostino Sarubbo discovered that re2c incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

8d75d86d1f96b1554a259162c50a04843b0c0106.title: USN-4338-2: re2c vulnerability
8d75d86d1f96b1554a259162c50a04843b0c0106.body: Details USN-4338-1 fixed vulnerabilities in re2c. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. Original advisory details: Agostino Sarubbo discovered that re2c incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

b85299702ce37d41680926d10ef3cc3facaaebc6.title: USN-4366-1: Exim vulnerability
b85299702ce37d41680926d10ef3cc3facaaebc6.body: Details It was discovered that Exim incorrectly handled certain inputs. An remote attacker could possibly use this issue to access sensitive information or authentication bypass.

8b069bbed57ac683f1d04b28c742f506529e5d31.title: USN-4422-1: WebKitGTK+ vulnerabilities
8b069bbed57ac683f1d04b28c742f506529e5d31.body: Details A large number of security issues were discovered in the WebKitGTK Web and JavaScript engines. If a user were tricked into viewing a malicious website, a remote attacker could exploit a variety of issues related to web browser security, including cross-site scripting attacks, denial of service attacks, and arbitrary code execution.

0ff0f52616ee0c2c0a9fddaa3f85963f8a45c296.title: USN-4386-1: libjpeg-turbo vulnerability
0ff0f52616ee0c2c0a9fddaa3f85963f8a45c296.body: Details It was discovered that libjpeg-turbo incorrectly handled certain PPM files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to access sensitive information.

64d49778a662601e149c10fd13c0e0399b114567.title: USN-4454-2: Samba vulnerability
64d49778a662601e149c10fd13c0e0399b114567.body: Details USN-4454-1 fixed a vulnerability in Samba. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM and Ubuntu 14.04 ESM. Original advisory details: Martin von Wittich and Wilko Meyer discovered that Samba incorrectly handled certain empty UDP packets when being used as a AD DC NBT server. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Samba to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

908fa483a81494c8646e787b4c12e116dccf23fb.title: USN-4454-1: Samba vulnerability
908fa483a81494c8646e787b4c12e116dccf23fb.body: Details Martin von Wittich and Wilko Meyer discovered that Samba incorrectly handled certain empty UDP packets when being used as a AD DC NBT server. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Samba to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

acababfe8c1542c0b23ee635b2d5f071c719bb81.title: USN-4511-1: QEMU vulnerability
acababfe8c1542c0b23ee635b2d5f071c719bb81.body: Details Ziming Zhang, Xiao Wei, Gonglei Arei, and Yanyu Zhang discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled certain USB packets. An attacker inside the guest could use this issue to cause QEMU to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code on the host. In the default installation, when QEMU is used with libvirt, attackers would be isolated by the libvirt AppArmor profile.

3455d30b7fc158774ff15556507841468678f255.title: USN-4550-1: DPDK vulnerabilities
3455d30b7fc158774ff15556507841468678f255.body: Details Ryan Hall discovered that DPDK incorrectly handled vhost crypto. An attacker inside a guest could use these issues to perform multiple attacks, including denial of service attacks, obtaining sensitive information from the host, and possibly executing arbitrary code on the host.

fadbe01adb3f07c4af3b5a3801a1ede93a7ccd1a.title: USN-4493-1: cryptsetup vulnerability
fadbe01adb3f07c4af3b5a3801a1ede93a7ccd1a.body: Details It was discovered that cryptsetup incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

25edef3068162f3744f81649e0cfc205c9adc7aa.title: USN-4503-1: Perl DBI module vulnerability
25edef3068162f3744f81649e0cfc205c9adc7aa.body: Details It was discovered that Perl DBI module incorrectly handled certain calls. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

44b21fe513fa5022ba347eb3d1d00967de2244d0.title: USN-4441-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
44b21fe513fa5022ba347eb3d1d00967de2244d0.body: Details Multiple security issues were discovered in MySQL and this update includes new upstream MySQL versions to fix these issues. MySQL has been updated to 8.0.21 in Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. Ubuntu 16.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.04 LTS have been updated to MySQL 5.7.31. In addition to security fixes, the updated packages contain bug fixes, new features, and possibly incompatible changes. Please see the following for more information: https://dev.mysql.com/doc/relnotes/mysql/5.7/en/news-5-7-31.html https://dev.mysql.com/doc/relnotes/mysql/8.0/en/news-8-0-21.html https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujul2020.html

5c211a0b82db5ec5fe8e2f2fca522a229c9ec8a3.title: USN-4418-1: OpenEXR vulnerabilities
5c211a0b82db5ec5fe8e2f2fca522a229c9ec8a3.body: Details It was discovered that OpenEXR incorrectly handled certain malformed EXR image files. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted EXR image file, a remote attacker could cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

a5d76da663592d300cd3e0bb0149da491e8f21a7.title: USN-4438-1: SQLite vulnerability
a5d76da663592d300cd3e0bb0149da491e8f21a7.body: Details It was discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled query-flattener optimization. An attacker could use this issue to cause SQLite to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

f3660c1c74235aa970a88a204a42105ed6164ff7.title: USN-4445-1: Ghostscript vulnerability
f3660c1c74235aa970a88a204a42105ed6164ff7.body: Details It was discovered that Ghostscript incorrectly handled certain PostScript files. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted file, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to access arbitrary files, execute arbitrary code,

81c9728925a867629bb1b9292968a993a8f4cb2f.title: USN-4461-1: Ark vulnerability
81c9728925a867629bb1b9292968a993a8f4cb2f.body: Details Dominik Penner discovered that Ark did not properly sanitize zip archive files before performing extraction. An attacker could use this to construct a malicious zip archive that, when opened, would create files outside the extraction directory.

10be10225b925d35e7a0d8031c9845356756f180.title: USN-4447-1: libssh vulnerability
10be10225b925d35e7a0d8031c9845356756f180.body: Details It was discovered that libssh incorrectly handled certain requests. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

75539e27b1bd23b9ebef03b45ecdef56e0e4fd04.title: USN-4469-1: Ghostscript vulnerabilities
75539e27b1bd23b9ebef03b45ecdef56e0e4fd04.body: Details It was discovered that Ghostscript incorrectly handled certain document files. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted file, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause Ghostscript to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

f308ca41704218da89cbc4532508dec2d49611ee.title: USN-4265-2: SpamAssassin vulnerabilities
f308ca41704218da89cbc4532508dec2d49611ee.body: Details USN-4265-1 fixed several vulnerabilities in SpamAssassin. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM and 14.04 ESM. Original advisory details: It was discovered that SpamAssassin incorrectly handled certain CF files. If a user or automated system were tricked into using a specially-crafted CF file, a remote attacker could possibly run arbitrary code.

df0a859303e9fc506f32467b2b2146dabef200d2.title: USN-4265-1: SpamAssassin vulnerabilities
df0a859303e9fc506f32467b2b2146dabef200d2.body: Details It was discovered that SpamAssassin incorrectly handled certain CF files. If a user or automated system were tricked into using a specially-crafted CF file, a remote attacker could possibly run arbitrary code.

5cb938bc3316f1d277d7ec2dc41ab33d53bdbd42.title: USN-4380-1: Apache Ant vulnerability
5cb938bc3316f1d277d7ec2dc41ab33d53bdbd42.body: Details It was discovered that Apache Ant created temporary files with insecure permissions. An attacker could use this vulnerability to read sensitive information leaked into /tmp, or potentially inject malicious code into a project that is built with Apache Ant.

48885a2c38fb760eb99e9d8fea165e3000a1b5f8.title: USN-4491-1: GnuTLS vulnerability
48885a2c38fb760eb99e9d8fea165e3000a1b5f8.body: Details It was discovered that GnuTLS incorrectly handled certain alerts when being used with TLS 1.3 servers. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause GnuTLS to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

021ee1c0252d1fb17bf54c852daaf4a34ee544d0.title: USN-4514-1: libproxy vulnerability
021ee1c0252d1fb17bf54c852daaf4a34ee544d0.body: Details It was discovered that libproxy incorrectly handled certain PAC files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

34d5aefbda4ed85fbb73d423a7ddcffa4060b38c.title: USN-4560-1: Gon gem vulnerability
34d5aefbda4ed85fbb73d423a7ddcffa4060b38c.body: Details It was discovered that Gon gem did not properly escape certain input. An attacker could use this vulnerability to execute a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack.

b59027e3d2c6d38e4b7fddaa8432605e7f40aa69.title: USN-4667-1: APT vulnerability
b59027e3d2c6d38e4b7fddaa8432605e7f40aa69.body: Details Kevin Backhouse discovered that APT incorrectly handled certain packages. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to cause APT to crash or stop responding, resulting in a denial of service.

6120063ee8dc53973478d967079285c0fed82475.title: USN-4350-1: MySQL vulnerabilities
6120063ee8dc53973478d967079285c0fed82475.body: Details Multiple security issues were discovered in MySQL and this update includes new upstream MySQL versions to fix these issues. MySQL has been updated to 8.0.80 in Ubuntu 19.10 and Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. Ubuntu 16.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.04 LTS have been updated to MySQL 5.7.30. In addition to security fixes, the updated packages contain bug fixes, new features, and possibly incompatible changes. Please see the following for more information: https://dev.mysql.com/doc/relnotes/mysql/5.7/en/news-5-7-30.html https://dev.mysql.com/doc/relnotes/mysql/8.0/en/news-8-0-20.html https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuapr2020.html

dab7669b86b0fbfec567994c7e39e827cc23564d.title: USN-4280-1: ClamAV vulnerability
dab7669b86b0fbfec567994c7e39e827cc23564d.body: Details It was discovered that ClamAV incorrectly handled memory when the Data-Loss-Prevention (DLP) feature was enabled. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause ClamAV to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

208234c13aaf09ec308c4c9fe5c065810b284a64.title: USN-4280-2: ClamAV vulnerability
208234c13aaf09ec308c4c9fe5c065810b284a64.body: Details USN-4280-1 fixed a vulnerability in ClamAV. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM and Ubuntu 14.04 ESM. Original advisory details: It was discovered that ClamAV incorrectly handled memory when the Data-Loss-Prevention (DLP) feature was enabled. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause ClamAV to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

d250532fa51c6670c3bf1e18f339e1837f9a9ffe.title: USN-4359-1: APT vulnerability
d250532fa51c6670c3bf1e18f339e1837f9a9ffe.body: Details It was discovered that APT incorrectly handled certain filenames during package installation. If an attacker could provide a specially crafted package to be installed by the system administrator, this could cause APT to crash.

0ec5b18c1dcfa946288a50af14929cf63b160084.title: USN-4359-2: APT vulnerability
0ec5b18c1dcfa946288a50af14929cf63b160084.body: Details USN-4359-1 fixed a vulnerability in APT. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM and 14.04 ESM. Original advisory details: It was discovered that APT incorrectly handled certain filenames during package installation. If an attacker could provide a specially crafted package to be installed by the system administrator, this could cause APT to crash.

64153852ab237173b1ea43764d5885eaf964d23f.title: USN-4264-1: Django vulnerability
64153852ab237173b1ea43764d5885eaf964d23f.body: Details Simon Charette discovered that Django incorrectly handled input in the PostgreSQL module. A remote attacker could possibly use this to perform SQL injection attacks.

e1afcbb90826bae0141161194c31b4366d14be0d.title: USN-4295-1: Rake vulnerability
e1afcbb90826bae0141161194c31b4366d14be0d.body: Details It was discovered that Rake incorrectly handled certain files. An attacker could use this issue to possibly execute arbitrary commands.

40a661d311f3b28d52a71a7abf35c783574fa2bf.title: USN-4313-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
40a661d311f3b28d52a71a7abf35c783574fa2bf.body: Details Manfred Paul discovered that the bpf verifier in the Linux kernel did not properly calculate register bounds for certain operations. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory) or gain administrative privileges.

2bc4455fe56cbcb1af3be566f020af184c7ceee2.title: USN-4313-1: Linux kernel vulnerability
2bc4455fe56cbcb1af3be566f020af184c7ceee2.body: Details Manfred Paul discovered that the bpf verifier in the Linux kernel did not properly calculate register bounds for certain operations. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory) or gain administrative privileges.

4779c120e8de704b9caecda77b5036806ec32a71.title: USN-4296-1: Django vulnerability
4779c120e8de704b9caecda77b5036806ec32a71.body: Details Norbert Szetei discovered that Django incorrectly handled the GIS functions and aggregates on Oracle. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to perform an SQL injection attack.
